Title: Advertising firm owner booked for stalking former employee
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: An owner of advertising firm was booked for allegedly stalking and harassing wife of an engineer with Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC).

The 29-year-old woman lodged a complaint against Naresh Vagadiya, owner of Adking Publicity, alleging that he was forcing her to continue their relationship. She told police that she had taken up accountant’s job in Vagadiya’s company around four years ago. They had developed a relationship and spent private time together. After she quit the job and started working with a bank, she discontinued their relationship.

However, Vagadiya continued to make calls and send her messages asking her to continue their relationship. In a bid to pressurize her, the accused even revealed about their relations to her husband. He allegedly made several calls her her husband from a different number.

The woman admitted to her husband about the past and then decided to lodge a complaint.

Umra police is investigating the case.

Title: Textile trader ends life due to loss in business
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: A 47-year-old businessman dealing in sarees ended his life by consuming food grain preservatives at his home in Althan Canal road.

Anand Malpani’s family members informed the police that the deceased was upset after he suffered major losses in his business. Cops have registered a case of accidental death and started investigation.

Malpani was a resident of Aakash Earth complex and had a shop in textile market area. He was found unconscious at his home and died during treatment at a hospital. He is suspected to have consumed the tablets at around 9 am. His body was sent for postmortem and preliminary examination revealed that he died from poisoning.

Khatodara police confirmed that the family had revealed that the businessman was tense after suffering huge losses. While cops are yet to get the final PM report, preliminary investigation reveals he died from ingesting poisonous substance.

Police are yet to register statements of the family members. “The family was not in condition to be questioned. Police will register their statements once they complete the last rites,” said an official.

Title: Three of family killed as car rams into bike in Junagadh
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: Three persons of a same family were killed when a speeding car rammed into the motorcycle they were riding near Jhalansar village on Dhoraji-Junagadh Highway of Junagadh taluka on Tuesday night.

“The impact of the collision was so severe that two persons fell into the stream below the bridge. All of three were killed on the spot,” said K J Patel, sub-inspector with Junagadh taluka police station.

The deceased were identified as Deepak Makwana (19), who was driving the bike, his father Dinesh Makwana (40) and his father in-law Ishwar Vaghela (40), all residents of Makhiyala village of Junagadh taluka.

The car driver who had caused the accident fled from the spot after abandoning the vehicle. “We have booked the unidentified driver on the complaint of Jayanti Makwana, younger brother of Dinesh. We will be ascertaining the identity of the driver on the basis of the registration number of the car,” added Patel.

Title: Rajkot railway station gets ISO certification
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: The four railway stations under Rajkot division of Western Railway has got ISO certification . The international management system certification institution awarded Rajkot railway station ISO 14001:2015 certificate. It was received by divisional manager Parmeshwar Funkwal.

According to the statement issued by Rajkot railway division , the certificate is given for three years for following the direction issued by National Green Tribunal after verifying various criteria. The other three stations of Rajkot division — Surendrangar, Jamnagar and Dwarka are already certified by the ISO.

Title: Coimbatore lad makes his mark as tennis coach
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

It was in his early teens when Mukul Karthikeyan realized that he didn’t have the financial backing to pursue a professional playing career in tennis. But the 27-year-old city lad didn’t want to let go of his first love easily and started assisting coaches in various academies in the district while studying at SBOA Matric HSS and later at PSG College of Arts and Sciences.

He learnt the ropes swiftly and his work ethic saw him flourishing as a coach. His growing reputation took him to the US, Singapore and China and he started working with renowned coaches like Van der Meer, Jeff Coetzee (South African Director of Tennis), Yu Liqiao (Chinese national team coach) and Thomas Shimada (Japanese national team coach).

Mukul’s efforts bore fruit recently when he became the youngest inductee of Indian Coach of the Year 2017, a certificate awarded by the world’s largest tennis coaching organization Professional Tennis Registry (PTR). Last year, he had achieved another feat when he was promoted as PTR International Testers and awarded PTR Indian Tester of the Year, meaning he would now adjudge Indian coaches’ credentials. PTR is the largest global organization of tennis teaching professional and coaches with 16,300 members in 125 countries.

Mukul said this was possible after he met prominent US tester Dr Louie Cap when he enrolled into the PTR certification course. “It was Louie who referred me to Van der Meer. It was during my conversations with these two gentlemen I came to understand the various nuances of the game,” he told TOI.

The 27-year-old said since tennis was still considered to be an elite sport in the country, it was a risk that he took by becoming a coach. But he is glad it all paid off. “Pursuing a career in tennis can prove to be expensive. I was young when I realized my family wouldn’t be able to back me financially. So, I charted my course accordingly and I am glad it all paid off,” Mukul, who has worked in Shanghai and coached Shanghai Province Junior team during 2017-18 season, said.

Mukul, who was a part of the USTA coaching team for tournaments in China during 2016-17, stated that his aim is to produce world-class tennis players.

“I have travelled extensively in China and really did well despite the language barrier. I focused on the technical, mental and tactical aspect of the game and the players responded positively. I have also enjoyed working with the US team. I like to work with youngsters and my focus is to produce world-class players,” he said.

Title: Tamil Nadu: 3 who helped Hindu Munnani leader’s murder suspects held
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Mohamed Zaid (L), Imran Khan (C) and Mohamed Haneef Khan (R)

CHENNAI: Tamil Nadu ‘Q’ branch sleuths have arrested three men hailing from Bengaluru for helping the three men wanted for the July 18, 2014, murder of the Tiruvallur Hindu Munnani leader K P S Suresh Kumar flee the country.

Police said Mohamed Haneef Khan, 29, Imran Khan, 32, and Mohamed Zaid, 24, had harboured the three and helped them get fake documents to fly abroad. The three murder accused — S Syed Ali Nawas, 25, A Abdul Shamim, 25, both from Kanyakumari, and C Khaja Moideen, 47, of Cuddalore — skipped trial in December, following which the Ambattur Industrial Estate police conducted a search and reported them missing.

Police suspect they may be hiding in Bangladesh, but have no confirmation. The Tamil Nadu police said it had been keeping tabs on various fundamentalist elements and on Tuesday a ‘Q’ branch team arrested the three in Bengaluru with the help of the local police. Police also seized three pistols and 80 bullets from the three men.

Police said three men who had fled the country had been in touch with the men in Bengaluru and people in some other states, including Maharashtra.

The Tamil Nadu police had alerted their counterparts in Karnataka and Maharashtra about the possibility of fundamentalist modules operating in those states.

A city court remanded the three men arrested from Bengaluru in judicial custody.

Title: Engineer arrested for creating fake Facebook account & duping Delhi girl of Rs 30 lakh
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Ajay Galar

BHOPAL: A Bhopal-based 27-year-old engineer was arrested by city crime branch on Wednesday for posing as a doctor on Facebook and duping a Delhi law student of Rs 30 lakh after befriending her. The accused created a fake Facebook profile using his relative’s photograph picture and claimed to be a doctor working at AIIMS hailing from a Jaipur royal family.

The accused, Ajay Galar, 27, a resident of Chandon village in Itarsi lured the girl in his trap by promising to marry her and duped her and her father, who runs a factory in Delhi, on pretext of treatment of his father and sister’s treatment in London for almost seven years. The accused used voice changer application on his smartphone and talked to the girl’s father posing as his father admitted to a hospital in London.

Around two months ago, the girl learnt that the man whose photograph was used in the FB profile was married to another woman in May 2019. She checked the photographs and identified the name of the hotel located in Bhopal where the marriage reception took place.

After learning that the accused had conned her, the girl decided to trap him. She came to Bhopal along with her parents and a professor by flight on Sunday and took the address of accused’s relative from the hotel where his marriage reception took place. They visited the house of the accused at a village in Itarsi and called him to meet at a mall in MP Nagar. The girl then approached Bhopal crime branch and filed a complaint after which the cops nabbed the accused when he came to meet her at the mall.

Police said a case on charges of fraud was filed against the accused. The girl gave police concrete evidence which she herself collected from the Internet that the accused had duped around a dozen other girls in a similar manner using the same modus operandi. The accused was being interrogated by police.

Investigating officer inspector Ajay Mishra said that the victim aged 25, resides with her parents at Rohini in New Delhi and a gold medalist in Fine Arts. Presently, she is pursuing LLB-LLM from Delhi. Her father runs a factory in Mongolpuri in Delhi.

Mishra said that the victim girl stated in her complaint that in June 2012, accused Ajay Galar, 27, a resident of Chandon village in Itarsi, sent her a friend request on Facebook. When she accepted the request, the accused started chatting with her and introduced himself as an oncologist at AIIMS and a member of Jaipur-based royal family.

Mishra said that on his Facebook account accused Ajay Galar, used the photograph of his relative Sourabh Mehto, who is young and good looking, as profile picture. Mehto runs a chemist shop in Bhopal and was unaware of Galar’s activity.

Galar had told the girl that he visits remote forest areas to conduct research for cancer drugs, so he does not get time to talk. He remained in contact with the victim till 2014 and then stopped contact with her.

Mishra said Galar again contacted the girl in 2017 and lured her in his trap by promising to marry her. The victim fell in his trap after which Galar started pressuring her for money. Galar told the girl that his father had brain tumour and was admitted at a hospital in London. He needed money for his treatment. The victim girl and her father transferred around Rs 30 lakh in his account in more than 100 transactions during the past three years.

Mishra said that the accused Galar used voice changing app on his smartphone and talked to the girl’s father, posing as his hospitalised father. Whenever the girl tried to visit his house in Jaipur, the accused made silly excuses citing his father’s ill health.

Mishra said that around six months ago the girl got suspicious as the accused repeatedly said that his father was admitted at the London hospital. She then started digging into his Facebook account and found the account of Sourabh Mehto with same photograph used by Galar. In the account, she found that Mehto was married to another woman in May 2019 and their wedding picture was also posted.

Mishra said that this led the girl into depression, but her professor noticed change in her behaviour and informed the girl’s parents about it. The girl’s parents stood with her and immediately booked a flight for Bhopal along with the professor. They found the hotel where Mehto’s wedding reception took his address from the hotel. They met Mehto at his chemist shop and found that he was unaware about the happenings. A retired IG who resides in Bhopal helped the victim family and asked the crime branch to help them.

Mishra said that the girl’s family members visited Itarsi where they met Galar and his father. Galar was shocked to find them at their doorsteps and knew that his game was over. He sent a message ‘please forgive me’ on the victim’s mobile number after which the complainant called him to meet at a mall.

Mishra said that when crime branch nabbed the accused Galar from the mall, he started threatening the cops that the girl had donated the money in account of the NGO he runs for women welfare and that he will return the money if she wants.

Title: Coimbatore to host global expo for region’s growth
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

COIMBATORE: The city will host a global expo to bring together importers, investors, manufacturers from key sectors, technologists, service providers and traders in October this year.

‘Vibrant Kongunadu Coimbatore Global Expo and Summit 2020’, which would be held from October 16 to 18, will focus on practical opportunities for the region from across the sectors.

Representatives of the Vibrant Coimbatore Foundation said such an event was being held for the first time in the city. The event will give a platform for stakeholders of key sectors to discuss, share and debate on various issues, said a release.

Representatives said the event’s prime focus will be to bring inclusive development in areas such as innovation, sustainability, industry, technology, youth, women-owned businesses, skill development, knowledge sharing and networking. This event will also seek to create employment opportunities and give a boost to MSMEs here.

Representatives are expecting more than 250 companies to exhibit at the expo. For this, they will conduct road shows in 25 countries with the help of Indian embassies there.

Some of the sectors which would be represented at the expo are: Textiles and apparel, light and heavy engineering, tourism and wellness, agro products and food processing, information technology, construction and real estate, education and startups.

Title: UPTET paper leak: Nine held in Jaunpur, five in Ghazipur
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

VARANASI: In connection with the UPTET paper leak, five persons including centre in-charge of an inter college were arrested in Ghazipur , while nine solvers were arrested in Jaunpur on Wednesday.

According to reports, on a tip-off, the STF personnel nabbed five persons of the gang engaged in solving TET papers with the help of solvers in Ghazipur.

Those arrested in Ghazipur include Paras Singh Kushwaha, the principal of Buddham Sharnam Inter College, Chandrapal Kushwaha, Chandrahas Kushwaha, Ajit Kushwaha and the clerk Siyaram Singh Yadav.

25 copies of question papers of set C and D each, six mobile phones and Rs 4,980 cash were recovered. They were booked under Sections 419, 420, 120 B of IPC and 67 of IT Act.

During interrogation, the accused revealed that they ran a gang led by Paras to solve the question papers and collected money from the candidates of competitive exams. For TET exam papers, they had collected Rs 1.5 lakh each from 50 candidates. They leaked the question papers before the beginning of the examination to Chandrahas through the mobile phone of Ajit. Solvers seated at the nearby Glorious Public School managed by Paras, solved and gave the printed solved papers to the candidates at the examination centre.

Chandrahas, Ajit and Chandrabhan are employed at different power sub-stations in Ghazipur district. Similar cases were lodged against Paras during the UP Polytechnic entrance test (2016-17).

In Jaunpur, nine ‘Munna Bhais’ were arrested from different centres in Shahganj and Khetasarai. Jaunpur SP (City) Anil Kumar Pandey said the arrested persons belonged to Bihar and had charged Rs one lakh per candidate for solving the papers.

In Varanasi, the exam was conducted peacefully at 67 centres and no such incident was recorded. Varanasi DM Kaushal Raj Sharma along with SSP Prabhakar Chowdhary carried out surprise inspection at many centres.

Title: Navy ship Sumedha comes to the rescue of stranded ‘dhow’
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Visakhapatnam: INS Sumedha, presently on anti-piracy patrol in the Gulf of Aden, came to the rescue of the crew of ‘dhow’ Al-Hamid recently. A traditional wooden vessel known as ‘dhow’, Al-Hamid was detected by a Navy helicopter launched from the deck of INS Sumedha, which confirmed that the vessel was in distress and drifting near the coast of Somalia.

A boarding team along with a technical team embarked Al-Hamid for routine checks on board and render assistance. The crew of Al-Hamid comprised 13 Indian citizens. The technical team assessment revealed that the dhow had suffered a broken main engine shaft, which was not repairable at sea. The dhow was then towed to safety away from the Somali coast. Meanwhile, the owner of the dhow has sent another vessel for towing it to port for repairs. Before departure, Navy personnel provided fresh water and medical supplies to the crew of the dhow. TNN

Title: It might be a combination of metro and tram in Vizag
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy held a review meeting on the Vizag metro rail project in Vijayawada on Wednesday.

District collector V Vinay Chand, GVMC commissioner G Srijana and Amaravati Metro Rail Corporation managing director N P Ramakrishna Reddy were present at the meeting.

Though the CM had chaired a meeting to review the progress of various projects in the city just two days ago, Wednesday’s meeting focused on the metro rail project.

Urban Mass Transit Company (UMTC), which is currently conducting a study on traffic forecasting, future vehicular and population growth for the proposed 140-km metro rail project, is expected to submit its report in the next few weeks.

While the metro component of the project will be taken up in the first phase, the tram-model public transport system will be developed in sparsely populated areas such as the beach front, Pendurthi corridor etc in the second or third phase.

Even though the project will be taken up in phases, a fresh detailed project report (DPR) will be prepared for all the proposed 140-km network falling into the jurisdiction of the Visakhapatnam Metropolitan Region Development Authority (VMRDA).

The state government recently retracted the earlier bids and decided to issue fresh tenders for the project. On the other hand, the AMRC may shift its office from Vijayawada to Visakhapatnam and it is likely to be located on the sixth floor of the VMRDA office in Siripuram.

Title: Madhya Pradesh: SAFE kits for rape survivors absent in most private hospitals
Content:
Representative image

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

BHOPAL: Sexual assault forensic evidence (SAFE) kit to collect ‘physical evidence’ of sexual abuse survivors is not available in most private hospitals in the state capital. Collecting blood, semen samples along with other evidences immediately after a sexual assault is key to investigations in order to catch perpetrators and bring them to justice.It has been six years since the Union government first issued guidelines for medico-legal care (MLC) for survivors of sexual violence. It includes mandatory SAFE kits in government and private hospitals. The guidelines were reissued through a health department circular on Monday following the upholding of death sentence for the four convicted men in the 2012 Nirbhaya gang-rape and murder case.Bhopal chief medical and health officer (CMHO) Dr Sudhir Dheriya said, “If a demand requisition from the private hospitals is received, they would be definitely be given the SAFE kits. We cannot go out supplying kits without understanding the demand.”Availability of SAFE kits and adherence to guidelines is not yet part of a checklist for CMHO office’s private nursing home registration section. A private hospital association representative said, ‘I am not aware of the SAFE Kits’.“If protocols are not followed, critical evidence is lost,” said Sarika Sinha, ActionAid director of policy and campaigns. The number of rape victims going to private hospitals is minuscule. Government-run JP hospital is the one-stop crises centre that has tracked 1,300 cases in the last couple of years. Of these, 170 required MLC examination.The first point of contact for survivors in seven cases was a private hospital in Bhopal. One of the private hospitals was along the Hoshangabad Road. The survivor’s MLC was conducted there. However, when contacted, the hospital administration admitted they were not aware of the SAFE Kit.According to Madhya Pradesh Police data, there were 312 rapes cases in Bhopal in the year 2018. During the same period, MP home department’s medico-legal institute based out of Gandhi Medical College, Bhopal, reported around 270 instances where the rape accused underwent check-ups. Experts also reiterated that collection of evidence from the survivor in hospitals is extremely important.

Title: Maya Kodnani again gets nod to leave Gujarat
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Maya Kodnani

AHMEDABAD: A special court granted permission to Maya Kodnani , the former minister who is accused in the 2002 Naroda Gam massacre case, to visit other states by relaxing her bail conditions for another six months “so she can undertake a pilgrimage to get rid of her depression”.

The special investigation team (SIT) court granted this relaxation to Kodnani for the third occasion. Special judge M K Dave ordered that Kodnani inform the authorities at least 24 hours before she plans to leave Gujarat . She will have to inform the authorities within 48 hours on her arrival back every time. Kodnani has been told to provide her mobile number to the investigating officer and she will have to keep the number active throughout her travels outside Gujarat.

Kodnani sought relaxation in the bail condition of not leaving Gujarat, which was imposed in May 2009, claiming that she is “required to frequent outside the state for the purpose of composing herself from her ailment of depression by embarking on pilgrimages outside Gujarat along with her family members”. She is also required to attend social gatherings and functions outside Gujarat.

The court recorded that the state government did not raise any serious objection to the grant of this relief to Kodnani.

Kodnani had earlier sought permanent deletion of the bail condition, but the court granted it for six months in January 2019. The relaxation was later extended for another six months.

Title: Wadhwana lake could be Gujarat’s second Ramsar site
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

VADODARA: If all goes well, Wadhwana lake near Dabhoi could become the second Ramsar site in Gujarat after Nalsarovar.

The forest department has initiated the process to prepare a detailed proposal to get this prestigious status for the lake located about 50 km from Vadodara.

Wadhwana is home to thousands of migratory birds that visit the water body every winter. The state’s first and only Ramsar site Nalsarovar, 64 km from Ahmedabad, it is largest wetland sanctuary in the state and is popular for flamingoes.

“We have decided to convert the lake into a Ramsar site. Wadhwana attracts thousands of domestic and foreign migratory birds every winter. We want to develop the place and conserve it. We have roped in Bombay Natural History Society (BNHS) to conduct census of birds in Wadhwana for the first time,” said Dhaval Gadhvi, deputy conservator of forests (DCF), Vadodara.

BNHS will conduct the census professional and prepare a report that will help us in making our proposal for Ramsar site stronger.

“If Wadhwana gets Ramsar site status, we will get technical guidance to conserve the wetland,” Gadhvi told TOI.

The forest department will also get guidance for financial aid that will help them in maintaining the Wadhwana Lake spread over a radius of two km in a better way.

“It is already a popular site for bird watchers and tourists. It will also attract more tourists,” Gadhvi added.

So far, the forest department has counted 58,000 migratory birds of 60 different species. The number of birds seen last winters was 98,000 of 200 species but this year it is less as the lake is brimming with water. Migratory birds usually prefer shallow waters for nesting.

“Once we get the forest department nod, we will begin documenting everything about Wadhwana wetlands and the ecosystem around. It is a lengthy procedure and the criteria are also strict. We will also have to consult the community around,” said Bhavik Patel, a marine conservationist working for BNHS.

“There are many criteria but if we even meet some of them, it will be possible to get the status. The study is on to find out species of fishes available in the lake apart from the plants,” Patel said.

Title: Ex-Maoist leader Damodar arrested by Visakha cops
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Visakha rural police arrested Andhra Odisha Border special zonal committee (AOBSZC) member Bellam Narayana Swamy alias Damodar alias Azad (58) and his wife Gangi Madhi alias Poolbatti (51), at Addaru Veedhi village in GK Veedhi mandal on Tuesday.

Sources, however, said they were arrested when they were going to a hospital.

Damodar and his wife had reportedly left the Maoist groups nine years ago.

According to cops , there are more than 100 cases against Damodar. There is also a reward of Rs 20 lakh on Damodar and Rs 6 lakh Poolbatti, who is facing charges in more than 20 cases.

Damodar, a native of Tatimarri in Anantapuram district, joined the Maoist ranks in 1980. He worked in Nallamala from 1990 to 1997 and was shifted to AOB area in 1998.

He was reportedly part of several attacks on police stations at Yeleswaram, Kalimela, Anakapalli, Chodavaram and Koraput armed reserve centre, Darakonda armed outpost and others when Maoists were active in the agency areas.

Poolbatti joined the ultras in 1991. She worked in Kalimela squad and was involved in Dukkilanka, Rajulakonda exchange of fire incidents and participated in landmine attacks against security forces at Tellarai and Malkangiri-Kalimela areas.

Title: Priyanka in Kashi on Friday
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Varanasi: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will be visiting the city on Friday. She will stay here for three hours.

Congress city chief Raghvendra Chaubey said that Priyanka would land at LBS International Airport at 10 am and will leave for Rajghat. After offering prayers at Ravidas temple at Rajghat she is likely to meet the persons who were arrested and sent to jail for 10 days following anti-CAA protest on December 19. he said.

All the events will take place at Rajghat after which she will leave for airport at 1 pm. tnn

Title: Fix parking charges in Delhi markets: EPCA
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Civic agencies installed bollards as part of pedestrianisation plan at Kamla Nagar

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court-mandated Environment Pollution (Prevention and Control) Authority ( EPCA ) has in a report stated that pilot parking management plans at Kamla Nagar , Krishna Nagar and Lajpat Nagar-III markets have commenced , learnings from which will be scalable for other markets too.

EPCA, however, says that there is a need for fixing parking charges. In a meeting held with the civic bodies on Tuesday ahead of the submission of the report to the apex court, EPCA took a status report of all three markets.

Plans at Kamla Nagar and Krishna Nagar were found in an advanced stage. Krishna Nagar’s parking and pedestrianisation plans, which were implemented on Monday, have been made ‘permanent’, the east corporation informed the panel.

East Delhi Municipal Corporation (EDMC) on Monday successfully made a 1.5 km Lal Quarter street pedestrian-friendly by restricting vehicle movement. Unauthorised parking on the roads and hawkers from pavements have also been removed, EDMC said.

“For pedestrians, benches are installed at regular gaps and parking is allowed at newly identified parking lots. Fancy lights, flower pots and signage are other features which were added recently,” said a civic official.

However, the civic agency is yet to make certain roads one-way.

At Kamla Nagar also, demarcation on roads has been done clearly and no parking is allowed on certain roads and roundabouts. The south corporation at Lajpat Nagar-III has marked parking spaces using yellow paint but is yet to enforce the full project.

EPCA member Sunita Narain told TOI that the report, which will soon be submitted, will inform the apex court of the learnings from the pilot projects. However, the plans will not work without fixing the charges, she said.

“The file to fix the parking charges is yet to be approved and we will recommend for this to be fixed as soon as possible,” Narain added.

The Delhi Maintenance and Management of Parking Places Rules, 2019 were notified last year, which mandated that the 500 metre radius of a multilevel parking facility be designated as ‘no parking’ zone for all streets. In case some surface parking has to be provided in this zone, it would be priced at least three times the off-street parking rates.

The parking rules aim to discourage on-street parking for long durations through differential pricing and also moderate parking demand through dynamic pricing.

Title: Coimbatore: 32 shops fined Rs 5 thousand each for selling banned gutka items
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: Teams of food safety department officers have been conducting surprise raids at the petty shops in different parts of the city for the past four days as part of a special drive. They found 32 shops selling banned tobacco items and one shop using non-food grade plastic.

Designated food safety officer K Tamilselvan said of the 32 shops, 26 had already paid the fine. “The remaining shops are expected to pay it by Friday. Shops that fail to pay the fine will lose their licence and registration,” he said.

He said the shops were selling banned chewable tobacco products such as haans, cool lips and paan parag. “The shops were located in Gandhipuram, Arockiasamy Road and Devanga School in RS Puram, Singanallur and Sulur,” the officer said. Pointing out that they had inspected 112 shops in total, he said the shops that were selling banned items were using small sachets. “So, we could not lift the samples. Hence, we imposed fines,” he said.

A total of 31.8kg banned items worth around Rs 45,000 were seized during the special drive.

The drive was part of efforts to reduce movement of banned tobacco products in the district. “Though we are focusing on catching wholesalers and distributors, we believe that cracking the whip on petty shops that sell the banned items is also important to flush out the tobacco rackets,” Tamilselvan told TOI.

In December, food safety officers had received a directive, allowing them to impose spot fines on business operators who violate the norms.

While the first and second violations attract fine, repetition of the same violation for the third time will attract a higher amount of fine and cancellation of the registration certificate issued by the food regulator.

The officer said the spot fine system was expected to have a deterrent effect on petty shops that repeatedly flout food safety norms.

Title: Marathon hearing over, verdict comes next in Sterlite case
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: The highly contentious Sterlite case is ripe for judgement as the Madras high court has concluded its 39 days of marathon hearing and reserved its order on the plea moved by Vedanta , challenging closure of its copper smelter plant in Tuticorin .

Concluding the hearing, a special bench of Justice T S Sivagnanam and Justice V Bhavani Subbaroyan complimented the senior counsels and other advocates for maintaining a cordial atmosphere throughout the hearings. The bench said it would try to deliver the order as expeditiously as possible.

On February 27, 2019, Vedanta approached HC seeking to reopen Sterlite, which was closed in view of an order passed by the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board (TNPCB) dated May 23, 2018. Vedanta moved the plea as suggested by the Supreme Court. An interim relief sought by Vedanta to permit access to the 200-acre factory premises to carry out maintenance work was rejected by the court based on the assurance provided by the state that it would take responsibility of the premises.

The state government and TNPCB represented by the advocate-general Vijay Narayan and senior counsel C S Vaidyanathan opposed the plea terming Sterlite a ‘chronic’ defaulter and that ‘unrestrained pollution appears to be standard modus operandi of the company, as it has been found guilty of various violations globally.’

Vedanta’s senior counsels Aryama Sundaram and P S Raman countered the arguments by contending that the closure order issued by the state was nothing but ‘naked discrimination’ against the company and that the GO was only a knee-jerk reaction of the state to ‘appease’ a section of public with vested interest after 13 protesters were killed in a police firing . It also alleged a Chinese company was behind its closure and claimed that the company, which had financial interest in copper manufacturing, was funding protesters to agitate against Sterlite.

Citing TNPCB pollution statistics, Vedanta said a person living inside Sterlite is safer than a person living in Anna Nagar, Chennai.

Opposing the submissions, impleaders in the plea professor Fathima and Makkal Adhigaram explained to the court as to how the environment in Tuticorin has improved after the closure of the plant.

Title: Coimbatore: Normal life largely unaffected by trade unions’ strike against Centre’s policies
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Members of trade unions and government employees staging protest in front of the district collectorate

COIMBATORE: Around 1,000 people, among them Coimbatore MP P R Natarajan, Tirupur MP K Subbarayan, members of trade unions and government employees, were detained on Wednesday for staging protest in front of the district collectorate here as some of them resorted to road roko and stopped buses.

The protest was held as part of the nationwide strike called by trade unions to condemn the Centre’s economic policies and the move to privatize public departments and public sector undertakings. Protesters said norms to register trade unions were also made very stringent.

Overall, the bandh did not largely affect the normal life in the city. While a few nationalized banks didn’t work, a total of 27 buses that ply from Ukkadam to neighbouring Kerala were not operated in the morning due to security reasons. Apart from these, the daily functioning of the city was normal with buses plying on roads and shops remaining open.

Speaking at the demonstration, the Tirupur MP said it was just a token protest against the Centre’s policies. “As trade unions have realized that they can’t fight alone, they have come together. Labour laws have been amended in worker unfriendly manners. There is no job security. These are anti-democratic and anti-labour moves. Around 25 crore workers across the country are striking and protesting today.”

Subbarayan said if the Centre did not hold talks with trade unions and bring in labour-friendly laws even after the nation-wide strike, they would take the protest to the next stage.

Trade union representatives, who participated in the protest, also put forth their specific demands.

Members of All India Central Council of Trade Unions (AICCTU) said sanitary workers were not being paid the basic wage of Rs 580 a day. “There are 6,000 sanitary workers in Coimbatore. They are not given retirement benefits and provident fund gratuity. Even after working for 10 years as contract labourers, they are not being made permanent. They should be given land and housing facilities as in the case of other government workers,” said Venkatachalam, a district representative of AICCTU. They also raised slogans against the Citizenship Amendment Act and National Register of Citizens.

Members of Hind Mazdoor Sabha’s unorganized workers’ wing said 4,000 of them had not been paid the monthly pension of Rs 6,000 for the past six months. These workers go to shops as salespeople, work as tailors, cooks and roadside vendors.

V M Michaelraj, state information and communication secretary, Tamil Nadu Post Graduate Teachers’ Association, said they wanted the new pension scheme to be scrapped. “The government should also revoke the new education policy. The basic pension for government staff is now Rs 3,000. It should be raised to Rs 18,000.”

Pointing out that the vacant posts in government departments that arise due to retirements were not being filled, he called on the state to fill those posts soon.

Women members of Tamil Nadu Anganwadi Workers and Helpers’ Union, meanwhile, said they were not recognized as permanent workers, despite putting in full day’s work. They said their pay should be hiked to Rs 21,000 from the present Rs 6,000. They also urged the state to appoint anganwadi workers as teachers in LKG and UKG in government schools.

Title: 300 stone crushers operating in Telangana without PCB consent
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representational Image

HYDERABAD: Out of 1000 stone crusher units in the state that are causing pollution, around 300 are operating without the consent of the Pollution Control Board (PCB). Despite a vigilance report, the state government has failed to act on these polluting crushers.

A RTI reply from PCB says they have information on 690 stone crushers units operating in the state, out of which 227 were given closure notice for irregularities. Barring a few exceptions, most of the units are working in the state despite closure orders by PCB.

Rules say that the stone crusher units shall not operate within 800 metres of human habitations, but most of them are located near cities, towns and villages including near Hyderabad.

“There are around 300 crushers running without permission in the state. I have lodged a complaint regarding 12 unauthorised crushers running in GO 111 area and many of them are near Outer Ring Road,” activist Thakur Raj Kumar Singh told TOI.

“Although notifications say no stone crusher unit shall operate near ORR, they are still operating them in Vattinagulapally, Gopanapally and Khajaguda areas. In Vattinagaulapally, an infrastructure company is operating a stone crusher unit, despite NGT ’s orders,” he added..”

According to the notified rules, stone crushers have be 500 metres away from national highways and 100 metres away from state highways. Rules say that there should be a 5-metre wide green belt along the boundary of the site where the unit is located in the 50-metre wide buffer zone of the stone crushing unit.

The Vigilance and Enforcement department have recommended PCB to conduct a special drive across the state and initiate action against the erring stone crusher units.

National Green Tribunal took up the case in suo moto based on media reports and issued directions to PCB to take immediate action.

Retired IFS official Padmanabha Reddy said, “There is a lot of variation between figures furnished by TSPCB head office and regional offices. In Nizamabad alone, there are 84 crushers, out of which around 48 are running irregularly. Closure orders were issued.”

Title: 3 private trains likely to start from Habibganj
Content:
Representative image

BHOPAL: With the high-powered panel giving nod to rolling out private trains in the country, three such trains are likely to originate from Habibganj , connecting the city with Hadapsar (Pune), Agartala ( Tripura ) and Holambi Kalan (Delhi).According to clusters routes, Habibganj-Holambi Kalan train will be bi-weekly single rack train. Holambi Kalan is a suburban area in the Narela sub-division of north west Delhi. It is 22 km from the New Delhi railway station. The Habibganj-Agartala will be a weekly train that will cover 2481 kms. At present, there is a train connecting Habibganj to Agartala. Sources said the private train will start plying once it is launched from Habibganj. The 01665 - HBJ Agartala special runs from Habibganj to Agartala. The 01665 mail express train departs from Habibganj at 5 pm.The third private train route will be Habibganj-Hadapsar. At present, there are 11 trains connecting Bhopal with Pune. However, none of them connect Bhopal with Hadapsar where several IT parks are located. For past several years, engineering students have been demanding to connect Bhopal with Hadapsar. Hadapsar railway station is located in a suburb of Pune in Maharashtra. Sources said there are plans to start long distance trains from this station as there is no space for new trains at the Pune junction. This station will be a major stop for Pune -Daund suburban trains.Students and businessman said such connectivity to these places will give an extra edge to railways. “As of now I have no idea as what kind of private trains will be running. I live in Hadapsar and always wanted a direct train from Bhopal,” said an IT professional Ankit Yadav.A lot of sportspersons of kayaking and canoeing belonging to North East are getting training at Upper Lake. They said that Habibganj-Agartala train will be a big gift for them. “There is just one train now and that too is weekly. If there is another train on this route it will be a big relief for players like me,” said Binita Chanu.Private trains running on a particular route will have a head start of 15 minutes on other trains running on the same route, a maximum permissible speed of 160 kmph and also their own guards and crew, states a draft proposal mooted by the NITI Aayog.Route FrequencyHabibganj-Agartala WeeklyHabibganj-Hadapsar BiweeklyHabibganj-Holambi Kalan Biweekly

Title: Madhya Pradesh woman offers buffalo as bribe
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Ramkali Patel on her way to the tehsildar’s office with the buffalo.

BHOPAL: Things took a dramatic turn when a woman reached the tehsildar’s office in Sidhi district with a buffalo. Claiming that she didn’t have the money which was allegedly being sought from her for mutation, she urged the officials to take the buffalo instead.

Taken aback, the officials, however, rubbished the allegations. They said that transfer of title was already done on November 14 and the woman’s antics were a part of a conspiracy. The incident took place at the office of tehsildar, Sihawal, on Tuesday.

Ramkali Patel, a resident of Naudhia village, alleged, “I applied for change of title of my ancestral property. A bribe of Rs 10,000 was sought, which I paid, but the work was still not done. Again the money was sought, since I didn’t have it, I brought my buffalo here”.

When contacted, tehsildar of Sihawal, Michael Tirki, said, “Ramkali had come to office with a buffalo, she said that someone has sought bribe from her. Her case was at SDM office, but her work was already done on November 14, I even gave her a copy of the order.”

SDM Sihawal, RK Sinha said, “It was a conspiracy, her work was already done on November 14, it is also updated on the RCMS portal. Some people had apparently instigated her; it led to chaos in SDM court. So, application has been moved with police for registering FIRs against her and the other accused. The clerk named by the woman, who allegedly sought bribe, was admitted in a Nagpur hospital for three months for brain ailment and has returned recently.”

Title: Bharat Bandh: Protests held in Dehradun
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

DEHRADUN: Heavy rains failed to deter the members of several organisations from participating in the Bharat Bandh protests called by trade unions on Wednesday against what they alleged as “anti-people” policies of the incumbent central government.

Over 10,000 agitators blocked roads with marches and bike rallies during protests. They asked Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led BJP government to roll back “anti-working class”, “anti-people”, and “anti-national” policies.

Staffers of Punjab National Bank, Allahabad Bank, Ayurvedic colleges, and power corporation, members of Communist Party of India (M), Anganwadi workers, ad-hoc employees, pharmacists, and others joined the protests.

“Over 10,000 people, including those who came from Haridwar, Haldwani and US Nagar, joined the protests in Dehradun ,” said Lekhraj Kumar, secretary of Centre of Indian Trade Unions (CITU).

“From students to employees, people from every walk of life participated in the strike. We will also be sending a memorandum to the President seeking his intervention,” added Kumar.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: Alipiri toll gate to go FASTag way soon
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representational Image

The Alipiri toll gate, which is managed by the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams ( TTD ), is set to become the first non-NHAI toll plaza in the country to promote cashless travel by going the FASTag way soon.

Once the radio frequency identification-based FASTag system involving electronic collection of toll fees is installed, devotees going to Tirumala can zoom through the toll plaza instead of having to wait in long queues of vehicles. FASTag is a prepaid tag, affixed on a vehicle’s windscreen, that enables automatic deduction of toll charges and lets it pass through toll plazas without stopping for cash transaction. TTD operates the twin ghat roads leading and exiting Tirumala which stretches up to 35 kilometres together. The temple administration collects toll fees, as per rates approved by the AP government, from vehicles plying along the ghat roads leading and exiting Tirumala. The state-of-the-art toll plaza at Alipiri was built and is managed by the TTD.

The temple body has already got the necessary approvals from the National Payments Corporation to switch over from cash to electronic toll collection system and has tied up with SBI for back-end integration-related processes. TTD plans to operate around 26 FASTag counters at the Alipiri toll plaza , besides one-two dedicated lanes for TTD vehicles which are exempt from toll fees.

The only hiccup now is to rationalize the current tariff in place, to be able to synchronize it with FASTag.

The devasthanams has in place differential toll fees for same vehicles under different categories. For instance, a private car is charged 15, whereas the same car, if operated as a taxi, is charged 25. Similarly, TTD charges 30 for 8-seater SUVs, but the rate is 60 if the SUV has a commercial number plate. TTD would become the first non-government entity in the country to adopt the FASTag mode.

Title: Rain lashes Varanasi, flights diverted, cancelled
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Cloud cover, showers leave city shivering

VARANASI: A number of passengers remained stranded at Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport after several flights were diverted or cancelled due to bad weather on Wednesday.

According to airport spokesperson Ranjeet Verma, as many as six flights were diverted from their scheduled routes, while five flights were cancelled due to poor visibility.

The flights including Indigo 6E-897 (Bangalore to Varanasi), Indigo 6E-713 (Kolkata to Varanasi), SpiceJet 2985 (Jaipur to Varanasi), and Indigo 098 (Swarnabhumi to Varanasi) were diverted to Kolkata, while Indigo 906 (Delhi to Varanasi) was diverted to Ranchi and Vistara 631 (Delhi to Varanasi) was diverted to Khajuraho.

The flights cancelled were GoAir 768 (Varanasi to Ahmedabad), Indigo 7716 (Varanasi to Kolkata), Indigo 499 (Varanasi to Bangalore), Indigo 6635 (Varanasi to Delhi) and Indigo 716 (Varanasi to Bangalore).

Meanwhile, the weather remained cold with overcast sky and moderate rain since morning. The schools and colleges were already closed till Wednesday.

Title: Vadodara: Congress members detained
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

The workers were protesting against attack on NSUI members by ABVP

VADODARA: Around 30 Congress workers were arrested from the Sayajigunj area of the city while staging protests against the attack by Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) activists on National Students Union of India (NSUI) workers in Ahmedabad.

NSUI had planned the protest at Dairy Den in Sayajigunj and it was joined by Congress as well as Youth Congress workers. The workers were initially allowed to stage the protests, but were detained at a later stage. Those detained included city unit president Prashant Patel and leader of opposition in the Vadodara Municipal Corporation, Chandrakant Shrivastava. Congress members said that their protest was peaceful, but the police did not give them permission.

They alleged that the police was acting at the behest of the BJP and was giving permissions to BJP and other organisations to hold events in public. Patel said that the party had applied for permission for the protest. City Congress spokesman Amit Ghotikar climbed on a police van and started raising slogans. Cops too claimed the bus to detain him.

Title: Nearby residents move HC over home damage fears
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Kochi: Residents near the apartment complexes, scheduled to be demolished this weekend, have approached the high court for a court directive to urgently assess the market value of their homes to enable adequate compensation if damage is sustained during demolition .

The petition (WP-C No. 390/2020) was filed by Harichandra Sai KR and nine other residents of Nettoor through advocate Krishnadas P Nair. An admission hearing on the petition is scheduled on Thursday.

Stating that their homes and other structures are situated within a radius of 200m from the apartment complexes scheduled to be demolished on Saturday, the petitioners — who are residents of ward numbers 32 and 33 — have produced before the court a copy of the eviction notice issued by Maradu municipality as a precautionary measure.

In their plea, the residents said they are highly anxious and concerned about their residential buildings and other improvements on their properties. A representation was submitted before the municipality on November 20, 2018 and a representation was also submitted before the chief minister on December 8, 2018, seeking measures to redress their grievances.

A meeting was held on January 2 at the chamber of the minister for local self-government department in which residents and various authorities attended. But no effective decision to compensate them if their homes suffer damages was taken, the petition said.

Seeking a court order to immediately assess the market value of their residential and other buildings, the residents argued that authorities, including the state government and the municipality, are legally bound to consider their grievances. It is unfair to penalize them for the negligence of officials and they are the real affected parties of the demolition, the residents told the court.

Title: Chennai Trade Centre to double in space at Rs 300 crore
Content:
Tidco has offered an additional 9.5 acres of land for the project

CHENNAI: Tamil Na du Trade Promotion Organisation (TNTPO), which owns and operates the Chennai Trade Centre (CTC) at Nandambakkam, is in the process of doubling the facility’s capacity at an estimated cost of Rs 300 core. The move to expand the trade centre from about 20,000sqm to 40,000sqm will help the city attract international exhibitions that require larger space.TNTPO, a joint venture of (India Trade Promotion Organisation) ITPO and state-owned Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation (Tidco), is carrying out the technical evaluation of the two bids received in a re-tender floated recently for the expansion . Once the tender is finalized within the next few weeks, the additional exhibition and convention centre capacity will be made available in about 18 months.“Chennai Trade Centre with its present capacity has been achieving an occupancy rate of 75%, which is the highest for any such centre in India. But given our size, we were not been able to attract large international exhibitions, which look for a minimum 30,000sqm of space,” V R Subbulaxmi, managing director, TNTPO told TOI.“As a result, we were losing such events to Bengaluru and Hyderabad. Post expansion, with around 40,000sqm space at our command, the city will be able to host several large international exhibitions and conventions,” Subbulaxmi added. She, however, refused to reveal the names of the bidders citing confidentiality since the process is under way.At present, CTC, which has come up over 25 acres of land, has an exhibition space of 12,000sqm and a convention hall to seat about 2,000 people. After the expansion, it will have an additional exhibition space of 12,000sqm and a convention hall to seat another 4,000 people. A multi-level car parking to house 1,000 cars is also being built as part of the new project. Tidco has offered an additional 9.5 acres of land for the project.“With the kind of tourist potential that Chennai has over the other southern metros, it will be an added advantage for the city to exploit tourism too, besides tapping a larger share of the growing meetings, incentives, conferences and exhibitions (MICE) segment, by doubling the CTC capacity,” Subbulaxmi said.

Title: MCA orders probe into Karvy scam
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

(Representative image)

HYDERABAD: After running afoul of market regulator Sebi for illegally pledging client securities with banks to raise funds, Hyderabad-based Karvy Stock Broking Ltd (KSBL) has now come under the scanner of the Union ministry of corporate affairs (MCA).

The ministry, which has been closely following developments in the KSBL demat account case, has ordered a probe into the affairs of the Karvy Group flagship under Section 206 of the Companies Act, MCA sources told TOI.

The inquiry will be taken up by the Hyderabad office of the Registrar of Companies (RoC) as KSBL is registered here. The probe comes even as EY is conducting a forensic audit of KSBL for NSE.

MCA sources said RoC has been asked to examine if KSBL, its promoters and officials violated provisions of the Companies Act and committed non-compoundable offences which are punishable by imprisonment.

“RoC will look into instances of misrepresentation of facts or misstatements in filing of balance sheets and other necessary documents. It has also been asked to look into the relationship between various Karvy group companies and related party transactions,” said a senior official.

“It will also probe if there was any misuse or diversion of funds and will try to find out in what manner the money that KSBL borrowed from banks and financial institutions was utilised,” the source added.

Sebi had, in its order dated November 22, 2019, stated that KSBL had prima facie transferred Rs 1,096 crore to its realty company, Karvy Realty, between April 1, 2016, and October 19, 2019.

KSBL had pledged securities of around 95,000 clients to raise over Rs 2,300 crore from various banks and financial institutions including ICICI Bank , HDFC Bank , Bajaj Finance, Aditya Birla Finance, Axis Bank and IndusInd Bank among others in violation of Sebi's norms. Sebi had on June 20, 2019, asked all brokers to segregate clients’ funds and securities by September 30, 2019, and report compliance of its order.

Sources said MCA may ask regulatory bodies involved in the Karvy scam probe, like Sebi, as well as NSE and EY to share their reports in the matter as part of its investigation.

It is learnt that RoC has also been asked to examine the role of auditors in case of any irregularities.

Incidentally, this is not the first time that KSBL has run afoul of the stock market watchdog. KSBL was one of the Karvy group entities that was found by Sebi to be involved in the infamous Roopal Panchal IPO scam that rocked the stock market in the mid-2000.

Title: Coimbatore: School students cultivate rice, add sweetness to Pongal celebrations
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

School students cultivating rice for Pongal celebration.

COIMBATORE: Around 800 students of St John’s Matriculation Higher Secondary School in Veerapandi Pirivu near the city are gearing up to celebrate Pongal on their campus on Saturday. The pongal they are going to cook would be special. Reason? The rice they would use for it was sown, cultivated and harvested by students themselves.

The credit goes to the school’s agricultural science group students, who had sown the rice variety TKM13. All the processes - right from preparing the field, sowing, taking care of the crop and harvesting - were done by the students of agricultural science group.

The students have produced 250kg paddy from 12 cents of land. This would translate to 5,208kg yield per hectare.

P Baskar, school principal, said they had been practicing organic gardening at the school since 2016. “We started by cultivating vegetables on our school terrace. Later, we started doing it on the campus. But we were not able to find seeds of native varieties of vegetables such as bottle gourd and brinjal. So, we started collecting native seeds. Now, we have seeds of around 50 native varieties of bottle gourd, 20 each varieties of ladies’ finger and brinjal. We share it with others as well.” They also cultivate groundnut, turmeric and shallots. Oil pressed from the groundnut is being used in the school’s hostel, according to the principal.

About the decision to cultivate paddy on the school campus, he said they wanted to sensitize students on how food was being produced. “Most of the time, students waste food casually. So, we decided to show them how difficult a task it was to cultivate rice.”

While the 32 Class XI and XII agricultural science group students were directly involved in the cultivation, the school management ensured that all other students witnessed the process stage by stage. “We made them see how the field is prepared, how paddy germinates and how it is harvested,” the principal said and lauded school correspondent R P Aravinthan, who was instrumental in the initiative.

The paddy was cultivated organically without any chemical fertilizers or pesticides. “We used only organic fertilizers such as panchagavya and dasagavya,” he said.

Students, who cultivated the paddy, said the experience was exciting and educational. M Juliana, a Class XII student, said while she had seen paddy fields from afar, this was the first time she actually got to step into one and work. “We were excited right from sowing to harvesting. We were also eager every day to see how the crop matures and bears rice. The main takeaway from the experience was learning how farmers put in dedicated efforts to produce food,” said the student, whose ambition is to become a researcher in organic farming.

The school does organic farming on a 50-cent plot on its campus, of which paddy is cultivated on 12 cents. The students, who sowed paddy on August 11 last year and transplanted seedlings on September 26, had harvested it on January 4.
