Title: Man gets 10 years rigorous imprisonment for abducting, raping girl
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

Title: Nagpur: High Court judges to inspect Lonar lake on Febuary 1
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: The judges hearing a PIL on Lonar lake in the Nagpur bench of Bombay High Court indicated on Wednesday that they may visit the historic crater on February 1 for spot inspection.

Before adjourning the hearing till February 14, a division bench comprising justices Sunil Shukre and Milind Jadhav directed the counsels for petitioner and government to make a brief note on matters to be examined during the visit, and submit it to the court, a week earlier.

The directives came while hearing a plea (No 4549/2009) by lawyer Kirti Nipankar along with Govind Khekale and Sudhakar Bugdane from Buldhana, through counsel Anand Parchure, claiming that Lonar Lake was slowly degrading because of pollution and silting.

In the last hearing, the HC observed that the funds released to the forest department for clearance of weed around the lake was insufficient. “Recently, it has been discovered that the weeds have spread over larger area and therefore, more funds would be required. The additional funds, which are likely to be required, have been estimated roughly by the department at Rs363 lakh.”

Additional government pleader Deepak Thakre replied that the estimate is yet to be prepared and proper proposal for seeking sufficient funds would be drafted at the earliest. “We would request him to send the proposal as early as possible. On its receipt, the competent authority should report it the Buldhana collector, who would accord his approval and sanction to it.”

The MTDC then made a presentation for development of the area with a budget of Rs91.29 crore.

The forest department informed that a sewage treatment plant (STP) near the lake’s rim was not being run in a proper manner. It demanded that a pact between collector and Nashik-based Maharashtra Engineering and Research Institute (MERI) should be signed for its smooth running.

“We request the collector to make appropriate arrangement, if required with NEERI, to ensure that in no case smooth functioning of STP is hampered. It’s necessary in order to preserve the originality of lake water and area surrounding it. The citizens should be discouraged from any kind of open defecation, which has been found to be still continuing to some extent by the forest department,” the judges said.

They directed collector to take urgent steps in collaboration with Lonar Municipal Council and ensure that practice of open defecation is given up forthwith. “If any public toilets are required to be constructed, necessary funds for the purpose be released and it shall be ensured that they would have 24 hours water supply.”

Title: All-India bandh witnesses good response in city
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Aurangabad: Joining the nationwide bandh, private and public sector employees, trade unions and bankers marched to the divisional commissionerate to press for their demands, including reduction in central and state government taxes.

The bandh was called by the trade unions and employees’ federations to protest against the privatisation by government and ‘anti-labour’ policies of the central government.

The workers and employee unions coordination committee said that the all India federations of various workers and employee unions decided to observe the nationwide bandh demanding that the government reduce the state and the central government taxes, lower prices of essential commodities as well as take steps to reduce unemployment, said Uddhav Bhavalkar of Centre for India Trade Unions (CITU).

Bhavalkar said the march was peaceful and no untoward incident occurred during the nationwide strike in the city.

The protesters raised a number of issues and slogans against Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his failure to address real issues. They also raised slogans to highlight local issues such as the pending demands of Videocon workers who have not been paid salaries since a few months.

Bhavalkar said that a memorandum was also submitted to the prime minister through the divisional commissioner. The memorandum stated that despite making several representations, the prime minister and the central government failed address the long-pending issues of workers, employees and the common people. “We demand that the prime minister should hold discussions with the unions to address these issues,” he said.

The workers and employee organizations’ joint action committee has submitted a list of 15 demands that require urgent attention. The demand includes concrete steps to curb increasing unemployment and to ensure that there is no scarcity of work. They also demanded recruitment on 24 lakh vacant posts in the state and the central government departments as well as absorption in services of those who have worked on contract, daily wage or honorarium basis.

They also demanded that the labour laws that were made for the benefit of owners be changed and the labour laws be implemented strictly. They also demanded a process to register workers in unorganized sector and stop privatization of public sector undertakings, said Bhavalkar.

The bandh also saw active participation of bank employees and officials. Devidas Tuljapurkar, general secretary of Maharashtra State Bank Employees Federation, said that six major unions, including the AIBEA, BEFI, AIBOA, INBEF, which represent around 80% of employees and 30% officers, too participated in the strike. “We are also focusing on opposition to merger, stringent recovery measures, adequate recruitment and early wage settlement,” he said.

Tuljapurkar, a former director of the Bank of Maharashtra, said that except State Bank of India and Indian Overseas Bank, the staff of all other banks participated in the bandh. He said across the Maharashtra, around 30,000 employees and 10,000 officers working in about 6,000 banks participated in the strike. These included 18 nationlised banks, 11 private sector banks and six foreign banks.

Title: Masked men trespass on GLS campus
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Ahmedabad: Navrangpura police on Wednesday filed a complaint for using abusive language and abetment, along with charges under the Gujarat Police Act, as unknown persons with their faces covered with handkerchiefs and carrying sticks entered the Gujarat Law Society (GLS) campus in Navrangpura on Tuesday morning.

According to the FIR registered by Dr Bhalchandra Joshi, 75, registrar of GLS, unknown persons carrying sticks entered the campus and began uttering abusive words. They drove in from the main gate of the varsity campus and exit from the rear gate.

Joshi had also given the registration number of the car to Navrangpura police, who have begun an investigation into the case. Police did not invoke the trespassing charges in the FIR.

Meanwhile, NSUI released a statement over the issue, alleging that ABVP members had entered the GLS campus to attack NSUI leaders.

Ahmedabad city NSUI president Asif Pawar, Gujarat NSUI office-bearers Digvijay Desai, Naran Bharwad, Parth Desai and Umang Desai in a joint statement said that that they were preparing for a rally on the GLS campus. ABVP leaders and BJYM president Rutvij Patel and Gujarat Pradesh BJP secretary Pradipsinh Vaghela had come to the GLS to attack NSUI leaders.

“Police did not take any actions against the trespassers. Even though the trespassers are seen clearly in video footage, police did not arrest any of them,” the NSUI statement said.

Title: Demand for inclusion of Tulu in 8th Schedule gets wheels
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Unique effort: Tulu script displayed on a city bus in Mangaluru

MANGALURU: A concerted campaign seeking inclusion of Tulu into the 8th Schedule of the Constitution , literally got its own set of wheels on Wednesday. This is thanks to the move by Dilraj Alva , owner of Sri Ganesh Prasad (SGP) buses that operate between State Bank terminus and Mangaladevi , in painting one of the SGP buses on route 27 with Tulu vowels and hashtags—#Tuluto8thschedule and #TuluofficiallnKA_K – supporting the campaign.

With Tulu predominantly spoken in this part of the state and in neighbouring Kasaragod in Kerala, Alva said this message being put on the bus will give the campaign a fresh lease of life. “We had a phase where those backing this demand did try out a Twitter campaign with the above hashtag, but it gradually lost momentum,” Alva told TOI, adding that the Tulu vowels and the above hashtags will remain on this bus to sustain the momentum for the above demand.

Displayed on the bus with the name ‘Irawata’, one of the five SGP buses that operate on route number 27, this is not for the first time that Alva has used his buses as a medium to spread the message on pressing issues. This experiment started five years ago when Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the Swachh Bharat campaign, Alva said, adding he also dabbled with the message on the need to preserve and conserve water, when the city stared at a water crisis recently.

The Tulu vowels are on the bus that got a fresh coat of yellow and green paint for fitness certificate on Sunday, and were embossed on Tuesday night at the garage. Alva, one of the conveners of Swachh Mangaluru abhiyan that Ramakrishna Mission, Mangaluru, undertook for five years from 2015, said such messages tend to have the desired impact in that it evokes curiosity among various stakeholders and common people alike.

Alva incidentally does not limit his responsibility to fostering such social issues. He is among the first private bus operators in this city to introduce buses with wide middle door as per the urban bus body code that the ministry of road transport and highways mooted. All five SGP buses plying on route 27 are designed as per this code. Alva said he is happy at the positive feedback that this initiative of his has evoked.

Title: Madurai: Panchayat president seeks police protection
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

MADURAI: K Nagalakshmi, the president of Sakkimangalam reserved panchayat in the district, has sought round-the-clock armed police protection after miscreants set ablaze the tent erected for her oath taking ceremony. In a petition to the district collector, she also sought CCTV cameras to be installed at her house and panchayat office.

“Only the government hopes that dalits will be uplifted by reserving such panchayats. But to this day, people from the BC community want to use us as puppets and take control of the panchayat administration,” she told TOI. However she admits that many non-dalits too would have cast their votes for her. The widow who grazes cattle for a living had unsuccessfully contested the panchayat president polls thrice in the last 33 years. Nagalakshmi secured 2,021 of the 5,600 votes polled and won by a margin of close to 300 votes. She said that till 11 pm on January 5 they were busy installing tent for oath taking the following day. Fearing threat from mischief mongers, she said they petitioned local police. However, next morning she got news about the tent being torched. Police registered case under sections 427 and 435 of IPC.

Title: NGO alleges swindling of funds under MGNREGA scheme
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

NAMAKKAL: A non-governmental organisation, Patthu Rubai Iyakkam, on Wednesday petitioned the district administration seeking action against authorities who had allegedly misappropriated several crores in implementing the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee ( MGNREGA ) scheme in the district.

“As per information obtained under the Right to Information (RTI) Act, we learned that the social audits carried out in villages across the state have revealed discrepancies in the records maintained for the scheme. Hence, the authorities have misappropriated several crores,” the petitioner and general secretary of Patthu Rubai Iyakkam Nalvinai Viswaraj said. The scheme was meant to ensure employment for underprivileged people for 100 days.

Various works from planting tree saplings, desilting water bodies and building micro checkdams were undertaken under the scheme. “For instance, if they plant 10 tree saplings, they would have recorded that 1,000 tree saplings were planted. Similarly, they have recorded exaggerated figures in many other development works in the scheme,” he added.

“Block resource persons should audit the records every year. We have obtained audit reports for the last three financial years for the districts across the state, and we could see several crores have been misappropriated,” he said. “Huge misappropriation of funds in the scheme could be unearthed if proper inquiry is conducted by the government ,” he added. Namakkal DRDA project director Malarvizhi said, “We are yet to get the petition from the district administration. We will conduct a thorough probe."

Title: Waiver won’t bail farmers out of debt, says Desarda
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Aurangabad: Noted economist and former member of the state planning board HM Desarda on Wednesday urged the government to adopt alternative development paradigm to ensure an equitable and sustainable pathway for the well-being of the farming community of Marathwada as well as the entire state.

He mentioned that the announcement of a loan waiver won’t completely bail out the farmers from the debt burden. “The most horrible trap is that of private unlicensed money lenders, input suppliers and such other elements who continue to exploit the farmers. The government has to take a firm stand on them,” he said.

Speaking to reporters here on Wednesday, Desarda said that land rights should be restricted only to those who actually toil on the soil. “Currently 60 percent of the land ownership vests in those who do not physically work on the farm. For this the government should bring legislation to grant land ownership or tenure rights only to those who actually sow and harvest the crop,” he said.

He said that he has made a representation to the chief minister Uddhav Thackeray on the same issue. He has insisted the government carry out a land-use census survey of the entire geographical area of Maharashtra state. He also pointed out that area under the forest shown in the government record is 52 lakh hectares was highly inflated. For example, he said, in Marathwada districts, the forest area was less than 3 percent. This is the root cause of the agrarian, droughts and other calamities, the economist said.

He urged the government to resolve the issue in a scientific way. “The Thackeray government should set up Maharashtra ecology, environment, forest, and climate the commission,’ with independent experts from diverse disciplines.”

Although, Maharashtra is one of the richest states of India, the record of the state in Human development is poor also the percentage of people living in slums is disproportionately high.

Title: Man shot at in Jhansi in old enmity
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

JHANSI: A man was shot at by three persons on a motorbike in broad daylight on Station Road in Jhansi on Wednesday.

The victim sustained injuries on his shoulders but is out of danger.

“Through CCTV footage of the entire incident, the accused have been identified as Sumit Valmiki, Saurav Valmiki and Sachin Valmiki, all real brothers from Bhattagaon,” said CO (city) Sangram Singh.

As per the details, the victim Manish Valmiki (28), resident of Bhattagaon of Jhansi, was standing outside a shop on Station road when three men approached on a motorbike and shot at him. Even before the people could react, the trio sped away.

Police rushed to the spot and sent Manish to Jhansi Medical College for treatment.

"The father of the three brothers was murdered in 2007. It is suspected that an old enmity was the reason behind the incident,” said the CO.

“We have lodged an FIR against all three accused under Section 307 of IPC at Nawabad police station. Efforts are on to nab them,” he added.

Title: Nitin Raut is guardian minister of Nagpur
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Nitin Raut

NAGPUR: Energy minister Nitin Raut of Congress is the new guardian minister of the district.

Dairy development minister Sunil Kedar has been given the charge of Wardha district.

Raut had been Nagpur guardian minister for some months during the Congress-NCP regime of 2009-2014 period.

Urban development minister Eknath Shinde of Shiv Sena has been appointed guardian minister of Gadchiroli district along with that of Thane.

Women and child welfare minister Yashomati Thakur of Congress has been appointed as the guardian minister for Amravati. Omprakash alia Bachhu Kadu, who is also from the district, has been made in charge of neighbouring Akola.

Home minister Anil Deshmukh will be in charge of Gondia district. OBC welfare minister Vijay Wadettiwar has been made guardian minister of Chandrapur district, from where he hails. NCP minister Rajendra Shingne will look after his native district Buldhana.

Shambhuraj Desai, an outsider, will be in charge of Washim district while another outsider Satej Patil will look after Bhandara.

Seven ministers including chief minister Uddhav Thackeray had taken oath on November 28. The cabinet was expanded on December 30. Now, appointment of chairpersons of various state government boards and corporations are being awaited.

Title: Madurai: Provocative speech-Nellai Kannan seeks to quash FIR
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

'Nellai' Kannan

MADURAI: Orator and writer ‘Nellai’ Kannan has filed a petition before the Madras high court seeking to quash the FIR registered against him for his provocative speech against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union home minister Amit Shah.

In his petition, Kannan stated the Melapalayam police in Tirunelveli district registered a case against him under Sections 504, 505(1)(b), 505(ii), 153 A, 506 (i) of the IPC.

According to the prosecution, while participating in a meeting organised by the SDPI party to condemn the Citizenship Amendment Act at Tirunelveli on December 29, 2019, Kannan had delivered the provocative speech by using specific words against the Prime Minister and home minister.

Kannan said the prosecution’s case is entirely misconceived as he was using a colloquial term in his speech and it was not his intention to affect any community or religious group but was only to voice for the aggrieved people.

He stated that the police without conducting any preliminary investigation had registered an FIR against him. Hence, he moved the high court Madurai bench seeking to quash the FIR. The petition is likely to be taken up for hearing soon.

It maybe recalled that following protests staged by BJP functionaries across the state, Kannan was arrested in this case recently.

Title: Truck hits 4 sleeping on footpath, leaves 1 dead
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

New Delhi: A person was killed and three others were injured after a speeding trolley truck ran over them while they were asleep on the footpath in southeast Delhi’s Modi Mill flyover area late on Wednesday night.

According to the police, the incident occurred around 1.30am under the Modi Mill flyover where a group of people were sleeping.

The trolley driver, who was speeding, broke the grills on the footpath side and ran over them.

The deceased has been identified as Lalan (55) who was stuck under the wheels of the truck. The three others injured were identified as 60-year-old Banwati, her husband Aadi, and their son Vikas, who were rushed to the hospital. The truck driver had fled by the time the police reached the spot.

Since Lalan was stuck under the wheel of the truck, a crane had to be called for the truck to be lifted for them to take him to the hospital.

However, by the time he was taken out, he had died.

Another damaged car was found behind the truck. The driver of the car, who was present during the incident, told the police that he was taking a turn and since there were no lights, he could not see the truck and rammed it from behind.

A case under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code has been registered at Amar Colony police station.

Title: Everybody free to express opinion: Prakash Javadekar
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

NEW DELHI: Amid calls, including at least one from a BJP functionary, to boycott Bollywood star Deepika Padukone 's upcoming movie "Chhapaak" for her visit to JNU, information and broadcasting minister Prakash Javadekar said on Wednesday that not just artistes, even a common man can go anywhere to express their opinion and there should be no objections to anyone expressing his opinion.

Nobody objected to such expression of opinions, Javadekar told reporters when asked during a Cabinet briefing here on Padukone's visit to the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) on Tuesday to express solidarity with the students who were attacked by a mob.

"This country is a democracy. Why only artistes, even a common man can go anywhere and express his opinion," the minister said.

About the call given by some party functionaries to boycott her upcoming movie, the minister said, he had not read their remarks but sought to underscore the significance of his statement, saying he is stating so as a minister and a "permanent" BJP spokesperson.

The minister's statement came in the backdrop of attacks on the actor by BJP functionary Tejinder Singh Bagga who called for the boycott of her soon-to-be launched film " Chhapak" for siding with the leader of " tukde tukde gang ", an allusion to the presence by her side of of CPI functionary Kanhaiya Kumar along with Umar Khalid and others accused of raising slogans seeking country's dismemberment.

While Bagga emphasised that Padukone's presence at JNU on Sunday at a gathering of leftist students was a partisan act, pro- Hindutva tweeter handles circulated footage of her Doordarshan interview of 2011 where she had endorsed Rahul Gandhi as PM. The saffronite handles also circulated a tweet purportedly posted by Pakistan army spokesperson Major General Asif Ghafoor using his personal handle: " Kudos@ Deepika Padukone for standing both with youth and the truth. You have proved to be a brave person in difficult environment earning respect. Humanity is everything," Ghafoor tweeted.

Ghafoor later deleted the tweet.

The director of Chhapak also attracted attacks for misrepresenting the faith of the man who carried out the acid attack on Lakshmi , the unfortunate girl played by Deepika on screen.

Her spouse Ranvir Singh became a collateral victim of the right-wing fury with twitter handles circulating her picture with UK businessman of Pakistani descent, Aneel Musarrat, who is an active member of Pakistan PM Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf. The handles circulated the photographs of Musarrat, who organised fund raisers for PTI, with Imran Khan, Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa and Major General Asif Ghafoor.

Title: Pune: Railway worker held for obscene texts, clips
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

Pune: The Mundhwa police have arrested a 59-year-old Central Railway technician on the charge of outraging the modesty of a Railway Protection Force (RPF) staffer by sending her obscene text messages and video clips .

The 37-year-old RPF staffer lodged a complaint with the Mundhwa police on Tuesday, following which the technician from Bopkhel was arrested. The police said the man would attend to diesel locomotives reaching a car shed.

The woman and the man had become friends a few days ago and exchanged their phone numbers. In the last few days, the police said, he made quite a few phone calls to her and sent some video clips through an internet-based messaging service.

The woman, in her FIR, accused the man of sending a vulgar and obscene video clip and an objectionable text message to her in the last two days.

Annoyed with the messages and the video clips, the woman reported the matter to her immediate bosses in the Central Railway and subsequently lodged the police complaint.

In another case, the Sinhagad road police arrested a 19-year-old man from Wagholi on the charge of threatening a 19-year-old college student on a social networking site after obtaining her private photographs. The police arrested him on the basis of a complaint lodged by the student.

The police said the two had become friends on a social networking site and the man subsequently made a video call to her. The police added that the man recorded the video interaction and started threatening her.

Title: Madurai: Trade Unions’ nationwide strike hits banking, insurance, but not normal life in city
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Members belonging to various trade unions took part in the protest that took place in front of Madurai railway... Read More

MADURAI: The nation-wide strike called by trade unions passed off without any untoward incidents in Madurai city. Demonstrations at various places by various organisations and political parties marked the day. Although a few sectors such as banking were impacted due to the protest, normal life of people was not affected in the city.

Most of the commercial establishments remained open as usual. In the commercial areas, around 10% shop owners closed their shops to show their solidarity to the bandh . Public transport was not affected as most of the auto rickshaws and city buses operated as usual. More than 2,000 policemen were deployed at various places across the city to avert any untoward incidents. Hundreds of people belonging to all trade unions attempted to block train at Madurai railway junction. A large number of police personnel posted there prevented them from entering the terminal. Protestors raised slogans against the central government for privatization of public sector undertakings, ‘anti workers policy’, price rise of essential items and sale of Air India.

A group of workers staged a protest in front of Life Insurance Corporation in West Veli Street. Services in banks, LIC, postal and insurance sectors were affected as employees in the sectors took part in the protest. A group of protestors attached to Jacto-Geo too staged a protest at Madurai district collector office. A large number of members from trade unions, CPM, CPI and DYFI took part in the protest that took place at Thamukkam. Madurai MP Su Venkatesan took part in the protest. Police arrested the protesters and released them later.

Protests also took place at Thiruparankundram bus stand and Thiruparankundram railway station. Madurai city police commissioner S Davidson Devasirvatham said that adequate precautionary measures were taken to maintain law and order. Any untoward incident was not recorded in Madurai city, he said. Protests by various trade unions and the opposition parties did not affect normal life in the southern districts as shops were open and buses and auto rickshaws operated as usual.

However, the bandh had an impact on the areas near the Kerala border due to the hartal that was strongly observed in the neighbouring state. Impact of the bandh could be felt at the bordering towns of Kaliyakkavilai in Kanyakumari district and at Puliyarai in Tenkasi district. Buses and vehicles were not operated in Kerala. Auto rickshaws drivers affiliated to communist trade unions did not work. Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) and private buses operated from various parts of the state to Thiruvananthapuram and other parts of Kerala were stopped at Kaliyakkavilai. This affected students and employees travelling from Kerala to Kanyakumari on a daily-basis as they had a tough time reaching the border. Students and employees travelling from Tamil Nadu to Kerala had less to worry as the bandh resulted in closure of institutions in Kerala on Wednesday.

At Puliyarai, buses were stopped ahead of the border in Tamil Nadu. Movement of goods vehicles between the two states was also affected.

Title: Group to push for tourism during CM visit
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Aurangabad: Different stakeholders from the tourism industry are looking forward to the first visit of Uddhav Thackeray to the city as the chief minister.

In a memorandum drafted by advocacy group ‘Aurangabad First’, the stakeholders have listed out pending and new demands. The memorandum will be handed over to him during the visit on Thursday. There is speculation that Uddhav’s son Aaditya, who is the minister for tourism and environment, may accompany him.

“Aurangabad district has a rich history, culture and heritage. The Unesco world heritage sites of Ellora and Ajanta attract national and international tourists to the city. The city itself has been declared the tourism capital of Maharashtra. However, the tag has not brought the necessary benefits or infrastructure yet,” Mansingh Pawar of Aurangabad First said.

Pointing to the dismal condition of city roads, non-existing footpaths, lack of proper signages along roads, poor garbage collection, the advocacy group said better efforts need to be taken to boost tourism. “Overall, the scenario is depressing. The tourism industry is passing through a difficult phase,” the group members said.

The group has pointed out that Aurangabad was to be included in the central scheme of HRIDAY, meant to conserve heritage sites in historical cities but it has not happened.

While Ajanta and Ellora have been included in the ‘Iconic Sites’ project by the government, but the work is not started yet. The advocacy group has demanded the state government should take initiative in the project and request the Centre to give funds for maintenance, conservation of these caves.

“The government must also encourage heritage walks and a proposal of developing ‘Aurangabad Haat’ in old city area be considered on a priority basis,” Pawar said.

The group wants the government to start special tourism courses in colleges and ITIs and setting up of a tourism directorate in Aurangabad.

Title: Organic love: Farmer donates kidney to wife, saves her life
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

a 47-year-old farmer from a remote village in Bhandara district saved life of his 44-year-old wife by donatin... Read More

Nagpur: In a rare gesture, a 47-year-old farmer from a remote village in Bhandara district saved life of his 44-year-old wife by donating his kidney to her. It’s a first such case at Super Specialty Hospital (SSH) where the procedure was performed.

The couple is now recovering well post-surgery and will be discharged soon.

In India, 80-85% donors for live renal transplant are women and 80-85% recipients are males. Kidney transplant specialist Dr Sanjay Kolte who performed the surgery said that in this case Rajesh was willing to donate kidney to his wife. Luckily their blood groups and other parameters also matched, he said.

“Blood relatives are the first to be approached for the live renal transplant. In this case, as the husband was willing to donate kidney, we decided to check the parameters,” said Dr Kolte.

He added that people having ‘O’ blood type can donate kidney to anyone. The Rh factor (+ or -) of blood does not matter in a transplant.

Rajesh, who is recovering fast, said that he has saved not only his wife but also entire family by donating kidney. “We have three daughters besides his elderly mother to take care of. My wife has been my companion in all ups and downs we faced over all these years. I only did my duty,” he said adding that his daughters are waiting eagerly to welcome their mother.

According to doctors, Laxmi must have been suffering from kidney disease from several years but she reported to SSH in June 2019 when the pain became unbearable.

“It’s unfortunate that women in rural India neglect their ailment until it becomes unbearable. Treatment becomes difficult if the ailment is at serious stage. Laxmi is lucky to have a husband like Rajesh. It’s quite rare for male patients to donate kidneys in our society,” said Dr Dhananjay Ookalkar, patron of Central India Nephrology Society.

Besides Dr Kolte, the team that performed the surgery included Dr Sameer Choube, HoD of Nephrology Dr Charulata Bawankule, and HOD of Urology Department Dr Dhananjay Selukar. They were guided by GMCH dean Dr Sajal Mitra and special executive officer Dr Milind Fulpatil.

Title: Search on for sexual assault suspect
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Pune: The Wakad police on Tuesday launched the search for a 30-year-old man booked on the charge of sexually assaulting an eight-year-old girl at her house on Monday afternoon.

An officer from the Wakad police said the incident occurred when the girl was alone at home. “The suspect went to her house and locked the door from inside. He then allegedly sexually assaulted her,” the officer said, adding that the girl narrated the entire incident to her mother after she returned home.

“The woman immediately came to the police station and lodged an FIR against the suspect. He has been booked under section 354-A (sexual assault) of the Indian Penal Code and the relevant sections of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act,” the officer said.

Brother-in-law booked for demanding favours

A 35-year-old man was booked on Tuesday on the charge of molesting his sister-in-law and demanding sexual favours from her at their house in Pimpri earlier in the day.

The Pimpri police said the action was taken after the woman lodged an FIR against her brother-in-law. tnn

Title: Chandigarh: Rs 2 crore works at Rock Garden come under audit lens
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

The world famous Rock Garden received a record number of visitors (File Photo)

CHANDIGARH: The audit report of the Rock Garden Society of the UT engineering department has raised questions over non-obtaining of utilization certificate and refund of unspent balance of Rs 2.02 crore for carrying out different works at Rock Garden .

The local audit department in its report, which was accessed by TOI, recommended directions be issued to the officials to get the certificate.

The report said, “Necessary directions may be issued to the officers/officials to get the utilization certificate from the divisions for the amount spent on execution of various works and make efforts to receive the unspent balance.” “During the audit for the financial years of 2015-16, 2016-17 and 2017-18, an amount of Rs 2,02,88,808 had been transferred to different divisions of the engineering department on account of execution of works at Rock Garden. Neither the utilization certificate from the divisions was received nor the unspent balance,” the report said.

The report said only Rs 17.77 lakh out of Rs 2.02 crore as unspent balance was received from the division.

The report also raised questions on the payment of illumination at Rock Garden.

The report said, “The managing body of Rock Garden Society in its meeting held on November 12, 2015, decided that funds will be arranged for illumination of Rock Garden from the engineering department. It was desired to make a reference by the superintending engineer, construction circle II, to the chief engineer, for sufficient funds in the next financial year whereas the expenditure was incurred from the society funds”.

The audit report recommended, “Expenditure incurred on illumination of Rock Garden from the society funds be claimed from the engineering department as per the decision of the managing body of the society or get the same regularized from the competent authority, the managing body.”

Box

Non obtaining of Labour Licence from contractors/outsource agencies

During the course of audit of accounts of Rock Garden Society for the financial years of 2015-16, 2016-17 and 2017-18, the audit department noticed that contractors/outsourcing agencies have provided labourers to Rock Garden Society without obtaining the licence from the labour department, UT administration. The audit report recommended, “Necessary directions be issued to the officers to get register as principal employer of the establishment by making an application to the registering officer in the labour department of the administration and condition regarding obtaining of labour licence from the labour department be incorporated in the detailed notice inviting tender (DNIT) as well as in the work allotment letter in respect of the contracts to which Contract Labour (Regulation and Abolition) Act, 1970 applies.”

Title: CMMAO: Be careful while travelling to China
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Aurangabad: The Confederation of Medical Associations of Asia and Oceania (CMAAO) has cautioned people travelling to China, asking them to avoid contact with animals and sick people as the country is grappling with a mystery pneumonia outbreak.

In an official release issued on Wednesday, CMAAO president KK Aggarwal has said that the viral illness was first reported last week in Wuhan, a central Chinese city with a population of over 11 million.

“The viral illness has grown to at least 59 cases. Though, Chinese health officials have ruled out a resurgence of the highly contagious SARS virus, which killed hundreds more than a decade ago, one should be aware and exercise precautions,” he said.

Aggarwal, who is also former president of the Indian Medical Association (IMA), advised travelers to seek medical care if they fell sick after travelling to Wuhan.

According to CMAAO, Taiwan’s centre for disease control has also advised residents planning to travel to or near Wuhan to wear masks and avoid contact with wild animals. The advisory to this effect was said to be issued early this week.

“All are being treated in quarantine and no obvious evidence of human-to-human transmission has been found so far,” CMAAO has said.

The outbreak of pneumonia in China comes just a few weeks before the country’s busiest travel season of the year, when millions travel there for Lunar New Year.

Currently, with 18 National Medical Associations (NMAs) as its members, the CMAAO is a 50-year-old body that aims to promote academic exchange and cultivate ties of friendship between member associations.

Title: Pune: Man issues fake ration card, booked for cheating
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: The Nigdi police on Tuesday registered an offence against a suspect from Dehugaon for cheating an Old Sangvi resident by giving him a fake ration card. The suspect had charged Rs1,200 for the ration card.

Nitin Padalghare, a resident of Old Sangvi, lodged an FIR with the police on Tuesday. The police have registered an offence under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code .

The police said that Padalghare came in contact with the suspect in October last year. The suspect told Padalghare that he had contacts in the ‘rationing department’ and would help him get the document. “The suspect took Rs1,200 from Padalghare and documents, including the copies of Aadhar cards of his family members, old ration card and photographs,” said an officer from the Nigdi police station.

The officer added that after 10 days, the suspect handed Padalghare a new ration card. “Recently, Padalghare had gone to the zone A divisional office in Nigdi to check if he could get rice and other items on his ration card. An officer checked the card and told Padalghare that it was a bogus ration card,” the officer said.

Title: Strike total in Ernakulam; police file two cases
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Kochi: The nationwide strike called by trade unions was total in Ernakulam district with Kunnathunadu police registering two cases for instances of violence.

A 70-year-old merchant, Poulose Kurian, sustained a minor fracture to his finger when supporters of the strike assaulted him and forced him to shut shop. A case has been registered against four unnamed persons.

In the second incident, a restaurateur sustained a concussion when protesters approached his shop and his hand got caught between the doors in the melee that ensued.

The strike in the city was otherwise peaceful, public transport almost completely remained off the road. Shops, establishments and educational institutions were closed, and government offices reported very low attendance.

The KSRTC conducted restricted operations to Pampa from the south railway station as few staff turned up for duty. Over 70 services were operated for passengers reaching the railway station. The KSRTC depot at Ernakulam wore a deserted look. Police had deployed vehicles for operating circular city trips for passengers reaching railway stations.

Most private vehicles kept off the road as well. Metro and trains were the only public transport available. However, people had to use private vehicles to reach the airport, railway and Metro stations. Only a few autos and cabs were seen on the roads.

Kochi Metro operated services as usual from 6am. Though there was a drop in the number of passengers, the Metro still recorded a ridership of 35,120 by 7pm.

However, a few roadside shops remained open. “We are not against the strike but this shop is my only source of income. I couldn’t meet my day-to-day expenses without opening the shop,” said Vimal K, a tea shop owner near MG Road.

Most of the major shops, however, remained closed either due to lack of staff or due to shop owners volunteering to down shutters.

Mohammad Rikas, owner of a print shop in Vyttila, said “We are closed today because no employees reported for duty.”

Boat services were suspended as most workers were on strike.

The usually busy markets in Kochi bore a deserted look as workers skipped work and cargo vehicles remained off the road. Most of the fuel bunks in the city also were closed.

The joint coordination committee of trade unions which called the strike took out a protest march from the Town Hall to Kaloor at 9am followed by a meeting near Kaloor Metro station. Protest marches and meetings were held in various places across the district.

Title: Biometric attendance under DTE scanner
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Aurangabad: The state directorate of technical education (DTE) has sought status of biometric attendance devices in different government colleges coming under its jurisdiction.

Acting on the directives from the headquarters, the DTE regional office on Tuesday told the institutions to furnish the desired details in the stipulated format.

Government institutions offering degree and diploma in engineering and pharmacy streams have come under scanner over assessment of biometric attendance system.

“Educational institutions have been asked to send details like total number of employees, including non-teaching staff, total number of biometric attendance systems, functional systems and type of attendance being followed. The compiled data will be sent to the DTE head office,” a senior DTE official said.

It should be noted that the state government has asked for mandatory use of biometric attendance system in government establishments with effect from March 2011.

Earlier in 2009, Maharashtra government had issued a circular asking implementation of the biometric time and attendance system in all departments under state government in order to optimize resource utilization and enhance productivity.

A DTE official said that biometric attendance in government colleges are under scanner in the wake of suspicion that a section of institutions are still not complying with the rule.

“The traditional muster system of attendance was considered vulnerable to unwanted manipulation and therefore the government has introduced the biometric system. The new system is considered as most secure and convenient authentication tool. It is one of the most sophisticated ways of recording attendance of employees and maintaining the leave records and overall working environment,” he said.

The DTE has over 50 autonomous institutions under its jurisdiction across the state and only government-run institutes have been told to furnish the details related to biometric attendance system.

Educational activist Sunil Rathod said the DTE must show courage to take a stern action against colleges that are still evading the biometric attendance system.

“The new attendance system was made compulsory in 2011. If the government-run engineering and pharmacy colleges are still evading the reforms, action must be taken. The traditional system of attendance has a huge scope of manipulation and therefore reasons behind the reluctance by colleges not to opt for the new system is also a reason for investigation,” he said.

Title: Donation of 21,3000 blood bags in 2019 at Sassoon benefit over 47,000 patients
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: The state-run Sassoon General Hospital received 21,347 bags of blood from voluntary donors last year, which benefited 47,318 patients at the facility.Each bag contained 350ml blood.In 2018, the hospital had collected 19,337 blood bags through voluntary camps. The hospital administration attributed the rise in blood donation to the active participation of charitable and social organizations.“The rise in blood collection through voluntary donation has been consistent over the years at our hospital’s blood bank . Instead of relying too much on people to come forward, we started approaching them to motivate and counsel them to donate blood. Today, the Sassoon General Hospital is one of the few state-run facilities, which always has sufficient blood bags in stock for transfusion throughout the year,” Ajay Chandanwale, the hospital’s dean and spine surgeon, said.Sharad Desale (49), the superintendent of medical social services at the hospital’s blood bank, said the facility started putting in more efforts towards blood donation from 2017. “Similarly, we also started approaching various colleges, institutions and organizations and counselled them to hold blood donation camps on their premises. All these efforts are paying off now. We need about 24,000 blood bags in a year to cater to the patients in need. We aim to achieve this target in 2020,” he said.Desale has been donating blood for the last 14 years. “I donate blood about two to three times in a year. On January 1 every year, I begin the work of the blood bank by donating blood. My daughter, who turned 18 on January 3 this year, also donated blood,” he added.Sant Nirankari Charitable Foundation, Robin Hood Army and College of Engineering Pune, were some of the organizations that helped the hospital in 2019. The administration said VIT College, Balaji University and Bharat Forge also chipped in.Mangesh Badad, the media coordinator of Sant Nirankari Charitable Foundation, said, “Around 80% of the blood collected from the camps organized by our charitable foundation was from our members and followers. The remaining 20% was from people who joined these camps because of our persistent work throughout the year. In 2019, we had organized 30 blood donation camps. We aim to hold 35 camps this year.”Leena Nakate, the hospital’s blood transfusion expert, said, “As blood cannot be stored for a long period of time and there is a continuous demand for it, it should be donated regularly.”Experts said children with severe anaemia, often resulting from malaria or malnutrition, also need blood, besides people with severe trauma following accidents, cancer patients and the ones undergoing various surgeries. “Regular blood transfusion is needed for people with conditions such as Thalassaemia and Sickle Cell disease. The donated blood is also used to make products, such as clotting factors for people with Haemophilia,” Nalini Kadgi, the in-charge of the hospital’s blood bank, said.

Title: How to enjoy classical: Notes from a Carnatic maestro
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Amita Dalal

Sitar stalwart Ustad Shahid Parvez set the course for Jogeshwari. Vidhwan Kumaresh, the violin maestro, had never played that raga. So when their collaboration began on Tuesday, Day 7 of Saptak, Vidhwan Kumaresh had to be guided not by practice but by premonitions. He had to anticipate the twists that lay ahead in his exploration to launch delicate sashays. He had to foresee smooth passages where notes could vault and roll. He had to modulate his virtuoso energies so that he and the ustad could reach the destination together.

Judging by the rasikas’ shouts of joy and praise, Vidhwan Kumaresh had taken them on a journey through the scenic route lined by lush instincts. “When I met ustadji before the concert, he suggested that we play Jogeshwari because this is Pandit Ravi Shankarji’s birth centenary year,” Vidhwan Kumaresh told TOI. “We don’t have an equivalent raga in Carnatic music. But a musician loves a challenge. I was able to play it because of the platform created by the masters.”

The young members of the audience had found elation in a spell of education. What can be done to attract more of them to classical concerts? Vidhwan Kumaresh said they shouldn’t bother about jargon. “Everybody enjoys musical moments, the melody content, the camaraderie between the artists, the parleys and exchanges, and the cries of ‘wah wah’…all these are part of the musical experience,” he said. On Tuesday, ‘wah wahs’ abounded at the venue.

At an earlier baithak, sitarist Amita Dalal essayed Shyam Kalyan. “I played a composition created by Dada Guru Pandit Ravi Shankarji,” Dalal told TOI. “I feel blessed to be a part of the legacy of Indian classical music with the guidance of my gurujis Vidushi Manju Mehta and Pandit Vishwa Mohan Bhatt .” Another baithak featured Pandit Ulhas Kashalkar. The muses visit him from Gwalior, Agra, and Jaipur gharanas.

Title: Chennai: Now, walk or jog along Marina Loop Road
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

The project will commence once clearance is obtained from Tamil Nadu Costal Regulation Zone Management Authori... Read More

CHENNAI: Soon, you can walk or jog along the beach without fear of running into fast moving traffic. The city corporation has planned to lay a 2.5-km-long footpath along the seaward side of the Loop Road that stretches from the light house to Foreshore Estate to ensure such activities, additional advocate general S R Rajagopalan submitted before a division bench of Justice Vineet Kothari and Justice R Suresh Kumar on Wednesday.

Producing a map of the stretch where the 4-ft-wide footpath is proposed, Rajagopalan informed the bench that the Greater Chennai Corporation commissioner had made a representation to the Tamil Nadu Costal Regulation Zone Management Authority in this regard and the project would commence once clearance is obtained. In addition to the footpath, fishermen would also be provided space to access the sea, he said.

Vendors of fish who currently occupy the seaward side of the road will be relocated to the market planned on a two-acre plot at Noichi Kuppam, he added.

Recording the submissions, the bench made it clear the court was not inclined to act against the interests of the fishing community and that it wanted the authorities to ensure it was provided with proper livelihood alternatives.

The bench then directed the corporation to obtain necessary approval and plan permission from the authorities concerned as expeditiously as possible so that it could undertake the construction in a speedy manner.

Separately, with regard to regulating hawking on the Marina beach, the additional advocate general informed the court that the civic body was in the process of preparing guidelines for allotting shops and providing vending carts to the identified vendors. “We can give a clear picture including the time required by January 22,” he added.

To this, counsel representing a group of vendors on the Marina submitted that at present at least 2-3 people from a family were involved in hawking on the beach whereas corporation has provided licence to only one person from each family.

Responding to the objection, Rajagopalan said that the authorities were in the process of hearing such objections and would come up with draft guidelines.

The bench then asked counsel for the vendors to forward their objections as representation to the corporation so that the authorities could consider the same and take a decision. It directed the corporation to produce the draft guidelines for allotment of identity cards to street vendors on the Marina by January 22.

Title: Practising exorcism, Bareilly woman inflicts 101 cuts on sister-in-law’s body, arrested
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

BAREILLY: Police have arrested a woman, identified as Moni from Bareilly ’s Sikalapur locality under Baradari police station, for practising exorcism , on Tuesday. Moni allegedly inflicted 101 cuts on her sister-in-law Renu’s body with the belief that it would cure her father’s ill health.

The police said that Moni’s husband Mooli and her brother Raju helped her in the act. Renu – in her 20s – required at least 300 stitches for the cuts on her face and other parts of body during treatment at a district hospital. Renu has been admitted to ICU where doctors said that she had over two dozen cuts on her face. The cops also said Moni, who is a local resident in her 30s, has been sent to jail and they are conducting raids to nab absconding Mooli and Raju.

Baradari police station officer inspector Naresh Tyagi said that following complaint filed by Renu’s brother an FIR under section 307 (attempt to murder) of IPC has been registered against three and they are investigating the matter. “We will record Renu’s statements in a day or two once she is stable and in a condition to talk to us. We have sent Moni to jail.”

Renu, a resident of Ganghora village under Bhojipura police station in Bareilly, was married to Sanjeev around eight years ago. It is learnt that his father-in-law, Jagdish, fell ill a few months ago.

“Accused Moni, who practice exorcism, decided to cure her father by initiating the act. Going by superstitious beliefs, they inflicted as many as 101 cuts on Renu’s face and body. It cannot be ruled out that they wanted to sacrifice her to complete the act,” police inspector said.

On Monday night, the accused had locked Renu’s husband and mother-in-law in another room who had tried to stop them from the crime. When the accused trio started inflicting cuts on Renu’s body, she struggled to get out of their clutches and somehow managed to escape from her house.

Upon reaching near Bareilly College, she collapsed and became unconscious. A police constable on patrol reportedly spotted her and she was taken to a district hospital. Once regaining her consciousness, she narrated her ordeal to the police who then informed her parents.

Title: Informal waste pickers to be part of Swachh Bharat
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Aurangabad: The central authorities have issued directives to the urban local bodies for integrating informal waste pickers into the national-level cleanliness programme of Swachh Bharat Mission.

Civic authorities have been told to carry out the field level assessment and identify waste pickers across the city, followed by the enrolment drives to integrate informal waste pickers in the Solid Waste Management (SWM )system. Besides waste pickers, self-help groups will be also integrated into the central mission.

“The Centre has asked local bodies to make a cooperative organization of identified informal workers. It will help in the proper integration of this workforce and ensure accountability. The waste pickers, as a part of the desired integration, are expected to be roped into the door-to-door collection and transportation of waste,” a senior official from the AMC said

The urban local bodies have been asked to keep a ward-wise list of waste pickers with ID numbers. “The civic administrations have been specifically told to conduct training for them to ensure proper integration into the SWM system of urban local bodies,” civic authorities said.

The central authorities have also asked to count the services of informal waste pickers on the payroll. As per SWM Rules, 2016, urban local bodies are expected to establish a system to recognise organisations of waste pickers or informal waste collectors.

Natasha Zarine, a city-based solid waste management expert, said, “More emphasis is being given to this concept now. It is a win-win situation for society and waste pickers.”

Title: Madurai: Cops fit ‘third eye’ in select buses, helps curb vandalism
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

The city has in the past seen damages caused to buses during hartals and officials believe cameras will check ... Read More

MADURAI: The city police fitted 64 cameras in select city buses operated by the Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC), Madurai on bandh day to deter vandals from damaging the windshields. The city had witnessed damages caused to buses during hartals in the past.

City police commissioner S Davidson Devasirvatham told TOI that the idea was put forward by deputy commissioner of law and order E Karthick during a discussion for precautionary measures to be taken for the nation-wide bandh. They felt it as a good idea to be implemented and immediately started fitting cameras. They had utilised the existing cameras in their possession.

An official from the technical wing of the city police said the 64 cameras were installed in 32 buses, covering both sides of the front portion of the vehicles. The cameras are equipped with inbuilt storage system to recorded visuals, while the power was drawn from the buses, he said. Another police officer said that they selected buses from various bus depots and importance was given to routes, where damaging of buses was noticed during previous instances.

“The cameras installed on Tuesday evening were removed on Wednesday evening. Buses plying to outskirts like Avaniyapuram and Tirunagar were selected since vandals target government properties in such places. Moreover, such areas do not have many CCTV cameras, so vandals walk free after damaging windshields,” he said. So far, no other police unit has taken such an initiative and it was tested only on a pilot basis. Based on its outcome, it can be continued in future also, he added.

An official from the TNSTC said that when the police came up with such an idea, they found it novel and cooperated in every possible way as it will help protect their property.

Title: Poster of ‘killers of humanity’ trampled upon at Shia masjid
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Bareilly: Angry with assassination of Iran’s top General Qassim Suleimani, a poster of US president Donald Trump and Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu calling them as “killers of humanity” has been pasted at the staircase of Aasfi Shia Jama Masjid in Bareilly. Shia Muslims in Bareilly have been protesting against the US drone strike since the Iranian general’s killing on Iraqi soil.

After prayers on Wednesday, locals stood on the two leaders’ poster and raised slogans against the US. Imam of Aasfi Shia Jama Masjid, Shamsul Hasan Khan, said, “The mosque committee has pasted the banner terming Trump and Netanyahu as killers of humanity following the murder of Iranian General Qassim Suleimani. The banner has been pasted on stairs so that people can walk all over it. US killed Suleimani due to their wrong policies. Shia community is upset with his killing and staging protests to raise the voice against injustice. Suleimani always worked for human rights and extended help to India.”

Appealing to government of India, Khan said, “Suleimani who spent his life in fighting against terrorism is being quoted as a terrorist by a few media platforms. We want the government of India to take action against such media platforms.”

Shameen Haider Zaidi, a retired principal, said, “We condemn the attack and killing of Suleimani. We will continue to raise our voice against atrocity.”

Shanu Kazmi, one of the protesters, said, “Shia community is mourning the assassination of one of the top Iranian general. We will intensify our protest to demand for justice. We will stage a mass protest on Friday.”

Title: Kerala: Civic bodies shoot down pilot survey’s CRZ findings
Content:
The process of filling explosives at Holy Faith H2O apartment complex in Maradu has been completed and the bla... Read More

KOCHI: Even while the pilot survey conducted by the town and country planning department put the number of buildings violating Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ) norms in Kochi Corporation and Maradu municipality at 93 and 41, respectively, the local bodies claim that the total doesn’t exceed single digits. As per the lists prepared by these bodies last month, there are just two violations within Kochi Corporation limits and only five in Maradu municipality limits.Following the Supreme Court verdict to demolish four apartment complexes for violating CRZ norms in Maradu, the state government constituted coastal district committees (CDCs), tasked with preparing reports of CRZ violations in the respective district. Authorities of local bodies where CRZ norms are applicable in the district had been asked to submit interim reports to the committee. Kochi Corporation and Maradu municipality prepared these lists as part of the third interim report which they sent to the CDCs.All ten CDCs are to submit their reports to the state government by January 12. The state government is expected to submit its report to the apex court. “The pilot survey put the number of suspected CRZ violations in Kochi Corporation at 93. But, the report sent to the coastal district committee states that the corporation could identify only two violations. Similarly, Maradu municipality has put the number at 5. There is an attempt on the part of authorities of local bodies to sabotage the process to identify CRZ violations. They are trying to let the offenders go scot-free,” said Nipun Cherian, coordinator, Chilavannoor Kayal Samrakshana Sangham.As per norms, the lists compiled by the CDCs should be announced, to elicit feedback and comments from the public. “On December 28, Ernakulam district collector on his FB page posted that the list of CRZ violations in the district has been uploaded. But the NIC website didn’t allow me to access it, citing technical snarls. Moreover, the district collector withdrew the post the very next day. The last date for the public to send their complaints or suggestions was December 31, 2019,” Cherian said.The pilot survey of high-rise buildings in Maradu municipality and Kochi Corporation was carried out on the direction of the district collector. “There may be many more buildings violating CRZ norms. It is the officials who prepared the list for submission to the committee,” mayor Soumini Jain said. Corporation secretary Anu RS said it was the engineering department which prepared the list. Superintending engineer Baburaj said that he hadn’t seen the report as it was prepared by the town planning department.At the same time, Maradu municipal chairperson Nadira said the report was prepared by officials and the technical details will be known only to them. Though TOI tried to contact Maradu municipal secretary Arif Mohammed Khan and municipal engineer Subhash over phone, they didn’t respond.

Title: Balwadi schools set to merge with anganwadis soon
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Balwadis, the pre-primary classes run by the state government, will soon be merged with the anganwadis.

The state education department issued a notification in this regard on January 4.

“The Balwadi schools have been asked to merge with the anganwadis in the state as the pre-primary education segment has been handed over to the women and child development department, which run the anganwadis,” Shailaja Darade, an officer at the state directorate of education, said.

The education department said classroom space for balwadis would be made available in the anganwadis.

The move has failed to cut ice with educationists and experts, who said a majority of the balwadi schools were located in the rural parts of the state and their merger with the anganwadis would benefit private operators, while leaving the enrolled students in the lurch. “Balwadi students from the rural pockets in the state will be forced to shift to nursery classes run by private operators,” an education expert said.

The notification also left the teachers from rural schools baffled. Raising major concerns over the move, the teachers said this was expected to encourage private players to open new schools in the rural areas.

Headmistress of a zilla parishad school Seema Bhagwat said, “There are very few balwadis left in the state. Though they have been doing well, their merger with anganwadis will jeopardise the education of the enrolled students. There are also concerns over the location and teaching practices in the new set-up. Some parents may be hesitant to send their children to anganwadis.”

Another teacher Vinodkumar Pol, said, “There are chances that the anganwadis, with which the balwadi schools are merged, may be located at distant places. Parents may not send their wards to anganwadis due to the distance. Eventually, some students might end up sitting at home.”

Title: Madurai: 50 thousand FBOs run without licence in Madurai
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Around 200 food business operators took part in the orientation programme organised by food safety department ... Read More

MADURAI: More than 50,000 food business operators (FBO) in Madurai district are operating without license, which is mandatory under Food Safety and Standards Authority of India ( FSSAI ), said designated officer for food safety, Madurai district, Dr S Somasundaram.

Addressing a large number of food business operators representing various sectors at a one-day orientation program on Wednesday, he explained about the legal aspects of FSSAI rules and regulations. The participants were sensitized on the importance of taking license, fair business practice and health issues consumers might undergo if the food is not prepared hygienically.

Officials say that of the estimated 75,000 FBOs in Madurai district, 12,000 FBOs have taken only registration certificate, which can be obtained by paying Rs 100, instead of a license. Only hawkers, whose sales is less than Rs 3,000 per day are allowed to use registration certificate. Those involved in production, processing, selling of food materials, including roadside eateries, hotels and grocery stores have to obtain license, said the food safety officials.

“When unintentional mistakes are found with the FBOs, they will attract lesser punishment if they have license. They will face stringent action like closure of shops and hefty fine and if they do not have a license,” Somasundaram said. Excessive use of colours can cause kidney problems to consumers. City hospitals have been witnessing increase in dialysis cases and other problems. Government Rajaji Hospital saw at least 4,611 dialysis cases in the month of October, 2019 alone, Somasundaram added.

Title: Madurai: Corporation employees protest in Madurai
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Large number of corporation workers staged a protest inside the head office in Tallakulam

MADURAI: A large number of corporation workers staged a protest inside the head office in Tallakulam putting forth a charter of demands, including filling up of posts, disbursal of pending salaries among others.

Employees from various departments of the corporation attached to different trade unions like CITU, LPF and VCK took part in protest. They raised slogans against both the state and central governments. They urged them to increase salary of employees, safety and job security. Trade union leaders addressed the gathering and sensitized them about various issues that would affect them.

The protesters demanded the filling up of 4,500 posts, which are lying vacant in various departments of the corporation like health and engineering, to disburse pending money of the Seventh Pay Commission to the permanent employees, to implement the 2015 high court order to appoint daily wage labourers as permanent employees, to ensure minimum wage as per a state government order dated October 11, 2017 to the contract labourers in engineering and health wing, and to prevent employees from entering manholes and to use machines to clear underground drainage.

They also urged the central government not to encourage privatization of education, health and water supply. They condemned the central government’s act of privatizing public sector undertakings like Bharat Petroleum, railways, electricity and coal.

Title: Cartel of doctors, pharma firms, labs fleecing patients: Madras HC
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Asserting that a cartel of doctors , pharma companies and diagnostic labs is fleecing patients in the country, the Madras high court on Wednesday took a suo motu notice of the practice of providing ‘commissions’ to doctors for promoting and prescribing their drugs.

A division bench of Justice N Kirubakaran and Justice P Velmurugan directed the Union health ministry, Union chemical and fertilizers ministry, the National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority and Medical Council of India to explain as to the action taken by them against doctors across in the country for violating the code of conduct and accepting gifts, travel facilities, hospitality, cash or monetary grant from pharmaceutical companies and allied health sector industries in the past five years.

The bench passed the order while expanding the scope of the plea moved by Fourrts (India) Labs Pvt Ltd – a pharmaceutical company challenging its income tax assessment. During the scrutiny of its assessment for 2012-13 the company admitted to a total income of Rs 14.69 crore and claimed deductions for Rs 5.45 crore towards licences and taxes and another Rs 42.81 lakh towards ‘sales and promotion expenses’ which includes payments made to doctors for promoting their drug.

Appalled over the submissions, the court said, “It is clear that even though accepting such commissions is prohibited under law, pharmaceutical companies are still promoting their drugs by providing gifts, travel facilities, hospitality, cash or monetary grant to doctors. It is also proved that drugs are overpriced illegally by the companies. It is shocking and surprising to note that the company claimed deduction from income tax for the amount spent towards sale promotion expenses as well as for licences and taxes.”

The bench then directed the authorities to answer to a series of questions including, the list of doctors who were paid by Fourrts, number of doctors prosecuted for violating the rule and accepting such gifts from 2009.

The court also wanted the authorities to answer as to the number of pharmaceutical companies that have been prosecuted for regulation of the drug pricing authority, number of pharma companies who have claimed tax deductions under ‘sale and promotions’ head, number of complaints received on over pricing of drugs, and amount recovered from pharma firms for over pricing.

This apart, the court has also directed the Union government to inform as to when a separate ministry for pharma and medical devices would be established as stated by the ministry of chemicals in February 2018 by January 20.

Title: Homebuyers in 25 stalled projects move MahaRERA
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: As many as 25 associations of allottees from Pune, Mumbai and Thane have approached the Maharashtra Real Estate Regulatory Authority for taking control of their stalled projects since January 1 this year.The Maharashtra Real Estate Regulatory Authority (MahaRERA) had last year issued an order, stating that the registration of an incomplete project could be revoked if 51% members of the association of allottees gave their consent to choose another developer to complete the project.The order was issued under sections 7 and 8 of the Real Estate (Regulation and Development) Act, 2016. “We have received 25 applications from associations of allottees (AoA) to restart their stalled projects,” MahaRERA secretary Vasant Prabhu said.MahaRERA officials said the applications of stalled projects were received from Pune, Mumbai and Thane. “The move will benefit stressed project where the developer had not been able to complete the project due to paucity of funds or any other reason for long period of time,” a MahaRERA official said.While filing a complaint, the AOA needs to provide a declaration that complaints regarding the project are been pending with the authority. They also need to provide a list of all stakeholders with available contact details, including the competent authority, promoter, landowner, investor, architects, engineers, chartered accountant, banks listed in encumbrances certificate, and any third party interested in helping with the stressed projects.The first order in this regard was passed on October 22 last year, in case of DSK Sadaphuli project of 279 apartments. This project was announced in March 2013, with the promise of handing over the possession of flats to homebuyers by November 2015.The project was, however, delayed and was nearly 90% complete when the builder faced arrest and has been behind bars since February 2018. Seeing no progress in the project, the buyers approached consumer protection group Mumbai Grahak Panchayat, which guided them about sections 7 and 8 promulgated by MahaRERA.The 131 homebuyers from the project then filed an application seeking MahaRERA’s permission to complete the remaining work, and restrain the mortgagee from selling or creating third party rights in the project. MahaRERA appointed a resolution panel, comprising developer Niranjan Hiranandani, president of National Real Estate Development Council, and MGP chairperson Shirish Deshpande. The authority also appointed a panel of professionals, including an architect, a chartered accountant and a structural engineer of the project.Experts from the real estate sector said while it was a good move, the framework needed to be clear.

Title: May have to declare KR Market unsafe: Karnataka high court
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Karnataka high court. (ANI photo)

Title: Consumers approach SC on bankruptcy code tweak
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Pune: Homebuyers from various organisations across the country have filed multiple writ petitions in the Supreme Court challenging the recent amendment in the Indian Bankruptcy Code, setting a minimum threshold limit on the number of homebuyers for approaching the National Company Law Tribunal to start the liquidation process against a defaulting developer.

Abhay Upadhyay, the president of the Forum for People’s Collective Efforts, a consumers’ body that had highlighted the injustice on homebuyers through letters to the PMO office and social media, said, “The amendments have been brought despite severe objections. Now that the matter has moved to the Supreme Court (SC), we are hoping that the SC will take cognizance of this issue and issue necessary directives.”

Last month, the government brought in an amendment under the Indian Bankruptcy Code (IBC) to introduce a minimum threshold of 100 or 10% homebuyers, whichever is lower, for take a defaulting developer to the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) for starting the liquidation process. The government later came out with an ordinance to clear it. Prior to this amendment, even a single financial creditor, including a homebuyer, with claims of at least Rs1 lakh could move NCLT against a defaulting developer.

Advocate Aditya Parolia, Partner, PSP Legal, representing various homebuyers’ forum across India told TOI that the ordinance passed by the government was highly unfair, arbitrary and against the interest of the homebuyers.

“This ordinance seems to protect only the builders, who have failed to deliver houses for years. A homebuyer cannot be expected to search for such a huge number of people. The cases pending against the builders in NCLTs across the country will be automatically dismissed in the light of this ordinance,” he said.

Title: PAC aspirant, aide held for fraud
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Bareilly: Police have arrested an aspirant who appeared in the physical test of the Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) recruitment here on Wednesday for alleged fraud.

Police said the accused, Udaybhan Singh from Mathura district, was carrying the admit card which had a photograph pasted on it different from the photograph pasted on theadmit card issued for the written test; besides, the biometric machine also rejected his fingerprints.

According to police, Singh confessed to having contacted one Ravindra Kumar in Aligarh, who had taken Rs 1.5 lakh for appearing in the written test at his place, while Udaybhan started preparation for the physical test.

Kumar took the written test, and now, Udaybhan arrived here to appear in the physical test, said police.

Following a complaint lodged by inspector Ram Naresh Mathur, in charge of the physical test, both Udaybhan and Ravindra, who is undergoing PAC training in Moradabad, were booked under relevant sections of the IPC, said inspector Avnish Yadav, Cantt police station officer.

Title: After Deepika, more Bollywood celebs speak up
Content: MUMBAI: Taking a cue from actress Deepika Padukone who visited JNU despite having a new release on Friday, several members of Hindi film industry including Sonakshi Sinha, Varun Dhawan, Sonam Kapoor, Twinkle Khanna, Suniel Shetty and Nikkhil Advani rallied behind the students of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) on Wednesday.Sonakshi Sinha voiced anger against the masked assailants of JNU saying, "No matter which political party you support, do you support violence? Don't visuals of bleeding students and teachers shake you up? We can't sit on the fence any longer. Kudos to Deepika Padukone for showing up, and all those who spoke for speaking up. This is not the time to stay quiet." Actor Varun Dhawan, who is touring Madhya Pradesh, called it a "sad and dangerous situation". He said, "(I) Cannot stay neutral on such issues. It's dangerous and sad if masked people enter an educational institution and all this happens."Director Vikramaditya Motwane tweeted, "Deepika's stand is going to make a lot of young people question their parents, their peers and their government. Hopefully they'll go out and educate themselves. And not parrot everything authority tells them. She's a true hero." Nimrat Kaur made a succinct comment, "Leading from the front, the tallest Deepika Padukone."Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap said: "It ( Deepika's visit to JNU ) sends out a very strong message of not just being in solidarity but of feeling their pain without fear. A lot of people in the film industry don't do it because it might go against their business but Deepika has managed to negate that fear and give courage to many others who were probably waiting for someone else to take the lead." Dismissing those who claimed Padukone's JNU visit was a publicity stunt, Kashyap said: "It's an even bigger statement when she does it on the eve of her film's release. Anybody in the business will tell you it is hara-kiri, especially when you are also the producer of the film.
