Title: With 13k cases, Bengal among top five states on suicide list; 19- to 29-year-olds most vulnerable
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Thirty stalls have been put up on SSKM campus for the four-day Kolkata Mental Health Fair starting from today

KOLKATA: A first-year computer engineering student of Jadavpur University committed suicide by jumping off the eight floor of the nine-storied building in the campus on December 19. This is one of the numerous instances where a youngster took such extreme step, despite having the possibility of a bright future.

“According to studies, 90% of the suicide cases are related to depression. In majority of the suicide cases, the victims are aged between 19 and 29 years. Depression is a silent killer. We need to talk about depression and other mental illness more often, so that the stigma attached with the ailment can be driven away. Those suffering from the illness can seek professional help before it is too late,” said Pradeep Saha, director Institute of Psychiatry (IOP) at IPGMER , SSKM Hospital.

While one in 7 men suffers from depression, the concurrent figure for women is one in 5. Mental health experts said that in addition to depression, 10% of the people battling with schizophrenia have the tendency to commit suicide.

According to 2018 National Crime Record Bureau data, West Bengal is among the five states with high number of suicides, the figure crossing 10,000 in West Bengal where 13,255 cases of suicide were recorded in 2018.

In an attempt to create awareness on mental health conditions and the treatment available, IOP in association with Kolkata Psychiatric Association is organising a four-day Kolkata Mental Health Fair in the hospital campus at IPGMER from Thursday.

“Though alarming, awareness and understanding of mental health is very poor and this leads to such ailment being not diagnosed or not reported. Mental health disorders are like any other ailments that can be treated,” added Saha who is also the organising secretary of the event.

Apart from doctors from the country, faculties from aboard, which include Mohan Isaac from the University of Western Australia and JS Bamrah from University of Manchester, will deliberate on different issues of mental health.

A theme song on the need to talk about mental health will be played in the background. Hundreds of people are likely to visit the 30 stalls that will be put up in the hospital. These stalls will render different services, including doctors attending patients, NGO workers helping people with substance addiction and legal aid services. Some patients who have recovered from their mental illness will talk to people, advising them not to shy away from seeking treatment for mental ailment.

Title: Lord’s missing jewellery ‘lost’, says TTD after reverification process
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Tirupati: Lord Venkateswara’s jewellery, which was reported missing from the well-guarded treasury situated in the administrative building of the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams in 2017 and which was exposed two years later in August 2019, has been declared ‘lost’ after the temple administration completed the process of reverification of the full inventory stock at its treasury.

It may be recalled that after the sensational expose in August last year, TTD EO Anil Kumar Singhal confirmed to the media that two gold rings, two necklaces worth Rs 4.2 lakh, one gold coin worth Rs 71,000, one silver crown weighing 5.4kg and worth approximately Rs 2.3 lakh, silver-coated copper coins and aluminium coins worth approximately Rs 14,500 were reported short during stock verification at TTD’s treasury. Though the jewellery was reported to have gone missing from the TTD treasury in 2017, the incident came to light only in 2019.

Following the development, Singhal had announced that TTD would carry out the exercise of reverification of all jewellery stocks at its treasury besides initiating recovery proceedings against assistant executive officer M Srinivasulu, the then in-charge of the treasury from where the jewellery went missing, to recover the value of the jewellery from his monthly salary.

After four months of reverification, TTD officials submitted their report to the EO, in which they stated that all articles, including the 5.4kg silver crown, are still missing. The temple administration may now initiate disciplinary proceedings against Srinivasulu.

Title: Maharashtra zilla parishad elections: BJP clear winner in Dhule, stakes claim in Nandurbar
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Dhule MP Subhash Bhamre (black jacket) celebrates with his supporters in Dhule on Wednesday.

NASHIK: North Maharashtra emerged as the sole consolation for the BJP in the zilla parishad elections, the results of which were declared on Wednesday. The BJP won the election in Dhule and has staked claim in Nandurbar but lost ground in its stronghold of Nagpur.

The party’s dominance in North Maharashtra came to fore with its emphatic win in Dhule, where BJP had won 39 out of 56 seats. The Congress-NCP and Shiv Sena had a pre-poll alliance in the polls. While Congress won seven seats, Sena three and NCP won four seats.

It is for the first time that BJP will come to power in the Dhule ZP . “The win is stupendous for us. We were expecting to win around 34 seats. The results have proved that BJP has cemented its base in Dhule, after the municipal corporation election last year. The results would be an eye opener for our opponents,” said Anup Agarwal, district BJP president.

In Nandurbar, a traditional bastion of the Congress, BJP has trumped up a spectacular performance, winning 23 seats. In the previous election, BJP had won only one seat. BJP insiders credited former minister and BJP MLA from Nandurbar Vijay Gavit for the party’s performance in the ZP polls. Four members from Gavit’s family — his wife Kumudini Gavit, brother Prakash Gavit and his wife Vijaya Prakash Gavit and niece Archana Sharad Gavit have been elected.

Similarly, Bharat Gavit, son of nine-time Congress MP Manikrao Gavit, and his wife Sangeeta Bharat Gavit were elected from the BJP camp.

This time, the Congress has also won 23 seats, Shiv Sena seven and NCP three. The Sharad Pawar-led NCP has reported a drastic fall of 22 seats compared to the previous polls.

A major loss for Congress in Nandurbar was the defeat of Hemlata Padvi, wife of state tribal welfare minister K C Padvi. Hemlata, contesting from Toranmaal, was defeated by the Shiv Sena candidate.

In contrast, Ajit and Madhukar, sons of former minister Surupsinh Naik, were elected from the Congress ticket.

Here, however, the Congress, Sena and NCP did not enter into a pre-poll alliance. The NCP and the BJP tied up in the fight in Navapur taluka, where they contested five seats each.

BJP Nandurbar district units president Vijay Chaudhary claimed that the success of the party in rural areas was astounding. “With this, the BJP has proven the fact that it is gaining popularity in the rural areas too. The BJP was in alliance with the NCP and hence its strength is 26,” he claimed.

Title: Nainital: Contempt proceedings against Ramdev’s Patanjali institute
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

HC contempt proceedings had been filed against Patanjali Bhartiya Ayurvigyan Evam Anusandhan Sansthan

NAINITAL: The Uttarakhand high court (HC) on Wednesday ordered yoga guru Ramdev ’s institute, Patanjali Bhartiya Ayurvigyan Evam Anusandhan Sansthan — which offers courses in Ayurveda — to refund to its students the extra fee charged by it.

The single judge bench of Justice Manoj Kumar Tiwari gave the institute eight weeks’ time to refund the extra money that the institute had charged from students of Bachelor of Ayurvedic Medical Sciences (BAMS) after a Government Order (GO) had increased the fee from Rs 80,000 to Rs 2.15 lakh. The GO had later been quashed by the HC.

Speaking to TOI, Vinod Tiwari, the lawyer appearing for the petitioners in the case, said, “The lawyer appearing for Patanjali has given an undertaking to the court that the fee will be refunded.”

The court’s order came while hearing a contempt petition filed by a student of Patanjali Bhartiya Ayurvigyan Evam Anusandhan Sansthan named Subham Pant who along with 23 other students alleged that despite the high court order quashing the GO of October 2015 that had increased the fee for the Ayurvedic colleges, the institute was neither returning their money nor were they collecting the fee according to the new HC order.

The October 2015 GO was quashed by the high court in July 2018 which held that the fee can be increased only by the fee regulation committee and that the increased fee should be returned to the students. The institute had approached the high court again in November 2018 and the court again said that the students’ fee should be returned.

The petitioner Subham Pant said that the students are now hopeful of action being taken by the institute. “Now that the court order has come, we are finally hopeful that our money will be returned,” he said.

SK Tijarawala, spokesman for Patanjali, meanwhile told TOI, “We are yet to receive a copy of the high court order. However, whatever the order is, we will study it and follow the directions accordingly.”

Title: Andhra Pradesh: 258 special trains to clear Sankranti rush
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representational Image

VIJAYAWADA: In a bid to regulate passenger rush, around 258 special trains – either transiting or originating from Vijayawada have been arranged so far, ahead of this year’s Sankranti festival. All trains have been operating from January 1 till January 20 to cater to the arriving-departing passengers.

Vijayawada railway division officials have already issued a travel advisory asking people to avoid crowding platforms during the festive season by saying their goodbyes from, and welcoming their relatives at, the concourse or waiting areas. Special train services are being run to cater to all class of rail passengers. There are Jansadharan (only second seating accommodation), AC Special, Suvidha (Special Fare) and Special Trains being run in all directions from Vijayawada.

Despite providing more than seven special trains between Vijayawada and Hyderabad, the waiting list numbers are still spiking as high as 350 in the past two days. Officials admit that they did not anticipate the rush to increase this much compared to the previous years. Railway officials said that most of the passenger rush was coming from Hyderabad to Vijayawada.

The second wave was towards Vizag and Godavari districts, while the third wave are mostly pilgrims heading towards Tirupati. Officials also said that they would be increasing the platform ticket prices to Rs 20 from Rs 10 during the festive days to regulate the crowd. A notification in this regard will be out in the coming days.

Senior officials said that they have deployed special duty staff to manage the platform timings to ensure that there is no inordinate delay compared to the previous years. They also said that this is the first time they are taking this initiative after studying the issues that arose during previous Sankranti seasons.

Passengers can also utilise the ‘UTS on Mobile’ App to book unreserved tickets on their smartphones.

Title: Government adds Kempegowda theme park to 80ft statue at KIA
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Bengaluru: The government will install an 80-foot statue of Bengaluru founder Kempegowda, within the Kempegowda International Airport premises, deputy chief minister Ashwath Narayan said, after chairing a meeting of the Kempegowda Development Authority on Wednesday.

The government also plans to develop a 23-acre theme park depicting the life and achievements of the feudal chieftain, which will give fliers a “glimpse” into the life of the city’s founder. “We discussed the design and concept of the statue and the park with experts in detail at the meeting,” Narayan said.

He said members also decided to protect and rejuvenate 46 places developed by Kempegowda in and around Bengaluru. “An action plan has already been prepared and it will be made public after a final decision at the government level,” the DyCM added.

Chief minister BS Yediyurappa had announced the grandiose plan in September last year in a bid to placate the Vokkaliga community which was said to be “miffed” with the BJP for dislodging the coalition government led by HD Kumaraswamy and for the Enforcement Directorate (ED) filing money laundering cases against DK Shivakumar.

Film city in Bengaluru

The government also decided to build a film city of global standards in Bengaluru. “We have identified the site for the film city and it will be made public after a discussion with the CM,” Narayan said.

Narayan said the government intends to build a film city that is a cut above others in the world. “It will have all the facilities required to produce a film including an animation centre,” Narayan said.

Asked why the film city is not being built either at Mysuru or Ramanagara — as announced by the two previous governments led by HD Kumaraswamy and Siddaramaiah — Narayan said Bengaluru is “known for its talent in animation films”. “Animation works of films like Avatar and Lion King were done in Bengaluru. Keeping this in mind, we decided to build the film city in Bengaluru,” he said.

He said the government will also build an arts and crafts village at the Devika Rani and Roerich estate on the outskirts of the city. “It will be one which the entire country is proud of,” he said.

Title: CCP’s request for toilets through Sulabh denied
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: The department of urban development (municipal administration) has rejected the Corporation of the City of Panaji ’s (CCP) request to build 300-odd toilets through the Sulabh International social services organisation to make the city open defecation free ( ODF ).

In a letter to CCP, the department sought a detailed justification as to why the proposed work should be taken up through Sulabh International “when alternatively CCP can tender the work and construct the said toilets”.

“The approval to Sulabh International was as per GSR 2015 and was based on reasonability of rates and was given on nomination basis on the justification of the impending ODF deadline. CCP is not due for ODF re-certification in the next three months and therefore, work can be tendered,” stated the department’s assistant accounts officer in a letter dated January 3, in reply to CCP’s October 30 request for approval.

Meanwhile, terming this as an “injustice” to the civic body, Panaji mayor Uday Madkaikar told reporters, “After all these months they’re now telling us to tender it. If we knew they were not going to give permission, we would have tendered it a long time back. There are many formalities involved in tendering. If it is a single tender we will have to re-tender it and time will be wasted. Then the monsoon will start. When will we build the toilets? They’re forcing us to tender it and give the contract to a private agency while toilets for the rest of the municipalities are being built through Sulabh International.”

“Panaji is not ODF,” he said, adding that people are openly defecating in Miramar and Caranzalem.

“We didn’t want Goa to get a bad name and hence, we took a resolution and declared Panaji ODF. Sulabh International is a government agency and there’s no requirement to tender the work,” Madkaikar said, adding that he would write to Prime Minister Narendra Modi as well as chief minister Pramod Sawant and urban development minister Milind Naik, over the said issue.

Madkaikar, in September, had stated that all CCP corporators had been “pressurised” into signing certificates in August stating that their wards were ODF. Further, he said that they had been assured that construction of toilets would begin immediately.

Title: Civic body to develop gardens at 20 municipal schools
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Nashik: The civic body, in order to bring students closer to nature and inform them about different species of plants, has decided to develop gardens at municipal schools where adequate space is available.

The Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) has shortlisted as many as 20 schools where these gardens are to be developed. “This new concept will be introduced in municipal schools from the financial year 2020-21. Initially, we have selected 20 civic schools that have adequate open space and playground,” an official from the NMC said.

“After the gardens are developed, students will be informed about different species of plants and trees, and the importance of green cover. They will also be involved in maintenance of gardens. These students are the future of the country. If we can manage to develop interests among them about nature then they will conserve trees and forest,” he added.

Earlier, there were a total of 126 municipal schools, but 36 were merged with other schools owing to inadequate strength of students. A decision in this regard was taken around two years back by the then municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe.

With the merger of 36 schools, the numbers of municipal schools have been reduced to 90. These schools have a total of 27,587 students — 13,277 boys and 14,310 girls.

Municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game is taking efforts to improve the quality of education in municipal schools. He is also encouraging teachers to impart quality education to the students.

As part of this, a team of total 45 principals and teachers of various municipal schools were sent on a study tour to Wablewadi school in Pune. The NMC is also taking efforts to make some schools as model schools to impart quality education along with best infrastructure and e-learning methods.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: Illegal quarrying threatens stone engraving from 1513
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

VIJAYAWADA: One of the biggest rock engravings in Andhra Pradesh is now reportedly under serious threat due to illegal stone quarrying at Chalivendula village of Hindupur mandal in Anantapur district.

E Sivanagi Reddy, CEO of Cultural Centre of Vijayawada and Amaravati (CCVA), who visited the spot on Wednesday, explained that the Kannada inscription measuring 20ft in length and 18ft in width holds significant record of incised drawings of Virupanna, the builder of the famous Veerabhadra temple at Lepakshi and footprints of Lord Siva.

“The inscription was copied and published by the Epigraphy branch of Archaeological Survey of India in 1917 and, by the State Dept of Archaeology & Museum under the supervision of professor P Chenna Reddy, the then director of the department. in the year 2009,” Sivanagi Reddy told TOI.

Reddy said that the inscription—dated to August 6, 1513 AD—is of historical importance as it records the genealogy of the Vijayanagara kings in various states of Andhra Pradesh. The inscription says that it was at the request of Virapanna, son of Nandi Lakkisetti and Muddamamba, that the king of Vijayanagara Empire gave Chalivendula village—surnamed as Achutendrapura—in the presence of the god Virapaksha on the bank of the river Tungabhadra to Virupanna for his services to the god Virabhadra, Raghunatha and Papavinasa of Lepakshi. “The engraving may be lost unless the quarrying activity is stopped immediately and declare it as a protected site and erect barbed wire fencing for safe guarding it,” Reddy added.

The inscription also records the donations of the village towards the construction of the world-famous Lepakshi Temple which could now potentially turn out to be a simple building material. Reddy requested the officials of the state archaeology department to divert tourists visiting Lepakshi Temple to the Chalivendula inscription spot by erecting a notice board, appointing an archaeological tourist guide and security personal.

Title: Gudi Sambaralu at Kondapalli Fort
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Vijayawada: The state archaeology and museums departments is all set to host Gudi Sambaralu in association with Parampara Foundation at Kondapalli Fort in Krishna district on Thursday.

Addressing the media, commissioner of archaeology and museum Vani Mohan explained that they are hosting the festival in a bid to promote the history and heritage of the site.

“More ever the department much emphasizing educate about not only the great history of Andhra Pradesh but also making as a learning and the tourists destination spots,” Vani Mohan said while addressing the reporters at the Kondapalli Fort.

In view of the above the department conducting “ANUBHAVA”, an experience of Hari and Hara Bharatanatyam by Leela Samson & Spanda Dance Company as part of Gudisambaralu programme with collaboration of Parampara Foundation.

In this connection the department project the Projection Mapping Show at 6.00 pm on Kondapalli Fort Wall.

Title: Kolkata: Apply online for Presidency University UG courses from today
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Presidency University

KOLKATA: The online application for admission in Presidency University ’s undergraduate courses will start on January 9 while the entrance examinations for different subjects will be held on April 11 and April 12.

West Bengal Joint Entrance Examination Board ( WBJEEB ), which conducts the admission on behalf of the varsity, has advanced the dates of submitting applications and entrance examinations so that they will have enough time to declare results before students enrol themselves in other colleges. Last year the exams were conducted in June and the results were declared in the middle of July when many students had already enrolled in other colleges. Many students, whose names featured on the merit list had already enrolled elsewhere by the time the results were declared.

This year the submission of applications has commenced more than a month in advance and this will give WBJEEB enough time to conduct the examinations in the first week of April.

“Students seeking admission can fill up the application forms between January 9 and February 6. They will be able to download their admit cards on April 6. The entrance examinations will be held on April 11 and April 12 and the results will be out by May 8. Some of the dates are tentative,” said an official of Presidency University.

The entrance examinations will be offline and students can apply for a maximum of two subjects. There are total 14 subjects where philosophy, sociology and performing arts are considered as one subject. A student can opt for either of the three during the counselling.

Title: Low-weight baby undergoes transplant as doctors use an eighth of donor’s liver
Content:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: In a rare surgery , doctors at a private hospital in Gurugram recently conducted liver transplant on a year-old girl weighing 5.2 kg using only one segment of the liver donated by her mother.A liver has eight segments. Normally, for living donor transplant where the donor is an adult and recipient is a small child, two out of these eight segments are used. However, doctors at Artemis hospital said due to the low weight of the baby girl, who suffered from a congenital disorder — Biliary Atresia — in which the connecting duct between the liver and the intestines is either absent or malformed since birth, transplanting even two segments wasn’t possible. It carried the risk of insufficient blood flow to the revascularised liver.Therefore, the surgeons separated segment II and III of the liver that have longer blood vessels and used only segment III for the transplant. The baby girl had an underdeveloped portal vein — a blood vessel that carries blood from the gastrointestinal tract, gallbladder, pancreas and spleen to the liver. To reduce the risk of reduced blood flow, the surgeons replaced it with a bovine jugular vein.Dr Giriraj Bora, joint chief, liver transplant and senior consultant, gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary surgery at Artemis Hospital, said bovine graft vein is used in cardiac surgeries but this is a rare instance when it was used in liver transplantation. “The liver transplant was carried out on November 23. The baby has recovered well from it,” Dr Bora added.Born as a third child to parents Ahmed and Sarah, the child had unusually prolonged and deep jaundice months after her birth. Doctors in Saudi Arabia, country she belongs to, diagnosed her with biliary atresia. They conducted biliary bypass surgery also but that was unsuccessful and unsatisfactory and therefore the girl was advised liver transplantation by the doctors in Saudi Arabia. However, considering her poor nutritional status and body weight (5.2kg) doctors in Saudi Arabia were reluctant and unwilling to perform such a complex liver transplant and she was referred to India.

Title: Karnataka set to hike housing unit cost post budget: Minister V Somanna
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Housing minister V Somanna addresses the media in Mangaluru on Wednesday

MANGALURU: Housing minister V Somanna said, “The per-unit cost of houses constructed under various housing schemes in the state is set to increase , after the presentation of the state budget. While the government at present sanctions Rs 1.2 lakh as unit cost, this could well be slightly more than double to Rs 2.5 lakh. The housing department will also look at a realistic target of constructing 2 lakh houses per financial year from April 1, 2020.”

In a chat with media on Wednesday, Somanna said, “I have already urged chief minister B S Yediyurappa to increase the limit to Rs 2.5 lakh and I’m certain that he will do so. The limit could at least be enhanced to Rs 2 lakh.”

This hike is a must, given the steep hike in cost of construction materials, Somanna said, adding this move will also give a fillip to the Union government’s ambition to provide housing for all in rural and urban areas by 2022.

Expressing dismay at the rot that had set in the housing department since the time he was in charge there, Somanna, without naming the governments or people in charge of the department,said,

“An inquiry ordered since I took over has helped unearth large-scale irregularities in housing targets with cowsheds, pigsties and goat sheds all being counted as dwelling units,” he said, adding the government has withdrawn grants allocated for around 7 lakh such homes.

“While grants for 5.95 lakh homes were withdrawn at the government level, grants for an additional 1.05 lakh homes were stopped following a high-level inquiry carried out by the chief secretary,” he said.

On the other hand, the government has sanctioned Rs 211 crore to help genuine beneficiaries spread across 173 assembly constituencies whose projects were locked out from the system for various reasons, by restoring them and releasing funds through respective ZP CEOs, he said.

Blaming his predecessors for stopping practices initiated by him to check fraudulent dealings including GPS tagging of houses, Somanna said the department is coming up with an app that will help nodal officers monitor progress real-time.

The process of scrutiny of housing applications will be reduced to 15 days, he said, adding discussions are on to transfer grants directly to accounts of beneficiaries, as was done in case of those affected by recent floods.

Appreciating the resolve of officials such as Satyabhama C, CEO, Chitradurga ZP, and Rohini Sindhuri, commissioner for sericulture development, in eliminating housing scheme frauds in their operational areas, he said housing schemes will be on track if there are officers of their kind.

“Rohini shut down an ‘inspection charge’ of Rs 75,000 that officials charged for a house of Rs 3 lakh given to sericulturists by the department,” the minister said.

Title: DCA cracks down on pharma portals
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Vijayawada: Drug Control Administration (DCA) officials cracked the whip on the online sale of medicines and initiated action against leading pharmacy portals like 1mg.com, phareasy.com, zoylo and netmeds.com. The director general of DCA , Kripa Nand Tripathi Ujela, in a statement on Wednesday, said that selling medicine online is not allowed according to the injunction order given by the Delhi high court.

The Drugs Controller General of India has recently sent a communication to the DCA to take action against online pharmacies selling medicine without licenses. Raids were conducted across the state on Wednesday over sale of medicine through websites.

During the raids at Guntur, officials found one Medrem Pharma Private Limited found to be selling medicine online. Officials also found other irregularities at Medrem Pharma following which their license was suspended.

“Officials have identified that the suppliers of these websites are located in Telangana, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu and action is being initiated against them,” said Ujela.

Ujela further directed officials to make sure that no pharmacy in the state sells medicine online till further orders. “Online sale of drugs may lead to misuse and abuse of several drugs like habit-forming drugs, medicine used in termination of pregnancies, and other prescription drugs which are to be used under doctors supervision, as improper use of medicine will develop resistance to antibiotics,” he added.

Title: Delhi: Cops get 11 complaints on clashes, forward them to Crime Branch
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Former JNUSU president Kanhaiya Kumar had joined Aishe Ghosh and other students in their protest against th... Read More NEW DELHI: Police received 11 complaints regarding the clashes at JNU and forwarded them to Crime Branch for inquiry on Wednesday. While seven complaints were from JNUSU members, including president Aishe Ghosh , three were from ABVP. One was from a professor. In her complaint, Ghosh said she received a call about congregation of a group of people and some ABVP supporters carrying rods, sledgehammers and sticks at Ganga bus stop . She informed senior police officers about it. She also spoke to a policeman posted on the campus. When the peace march by JNU Teachers’ Association got over, students and teachers started panicking and ran towards the Sabarmati T-point. She then noticed a mob with faces covered pelting stones and running after the students. She went to an eatery nearby and tried to calm down the students and pleaded with the mob to not attack the students. However, she was caught and dragged behind a car by 20-30 people, who hit her with a rod. The men then kicked and punched her. One of the attackers, who was wearing a sweatshirt, didn’t have his face covered and she could identify him. Manish Jangid, an ABVP member pursuing his PhD in environmental sciences, filed a counter complaint on Tuesday night. Jangid sustained a fracture on his left hand and bruises on his body after being attacked by a mob. He said he and others had gone to get their registration done at the admin block when the mob approached them. “Satish Chandra Yadav, JNUSU general secretary, was leading the mob. Aishe Ghosh was also a part of them. I and my three friends, including two women, saw the lock of a room broken and hid there. We locked the door, but the mob broke it open and called us by our names and hit us. I then ran out the back gate and reached the mess. I fell unconscious and was later rushed to a hospital in an ambulance,” Jangid said.

Title: Nagpur: Vijay Barse sits on silent protest in support of JNU students
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Well-known professor Vijay Barse launched a three-day protest at Samvidhan Square on Wednesday

NAGPUR: Amid different daylong agitations at the same place on Wednesday, well-known professor Vijay Barse along with a couple of his supporters sat on a three-day silent protest along the aisle of Babasaheb Ambedkar Samarak at Samvidhan Square in the wake of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) violence

The 76-year-old Barse, on whose life celebrated director Nagraj Manjule has produced yet-to-be released biopic ‘Jhund’, would continue his ‘Maunvrat’ and remain seated on a chair between 10am and 5pm for the next two days. The retired professor’s ‘Gandhigiri’ went off peacefully and but not unnoticed as those protesting CAA and NRC acknowledged his presence during their speeches.

Before this, the Left unions did overshadow Barse’s protest for sometime but later people identified him. Barse is famous for his concept ‘Slum Soccer’ which has inspired Manjule’s biopic featuring superstar Amitabh Bachchan who will be the playing the coach’s role.

Breaking his silence at 5pm, Barse garlanded the statue of Ambedkar. He said, “I am a Gandhian and follow what the Mahatma preached and practised. Gandhi would punish himself whenever the country went through such a situation. As a professor, I punished myself by staying quiet for what happened to students at JNU,” he said.

A day before, the Nagpur University students had staged a protest to condemn the attacks on JNU students which left several injured on Sunday.

Title: Kolkata Rain: Light rain may pave way for mercury dip
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

A man holds an umbrella while riding a bicycle during rain in Kolkata on Friday (ANI Photo)

KOLKATA: Brace for some light rain on Thursday. Do not forget to carry an umbrella while going out of home, as a cyclonic circulation formed over Madhya Pradesh will reach the city and trigger another spell of winter rain . The sky is likely to remain overcast throughout the day. However, the rain will bring back the chill by the weekend, according to Met officials.

“We can expect rain from the first half of the day. But the intensity of the rain this time would be lesser than the one that had lashed the city last week. Even if the minimum temperature goes up, the rain will keep the city cool with a dip in the maximum temperature,” said GK Das, director (weather) at the Regional Meteorological Centre Kolkata.

The maximum temperature is likely to be around 20°C due to the rain while the minimum temperature may go up to 15°C on Thursday and Friday.

On Wednesday, the minimum temperature was 13.4°C — a notch higher than normal.

The sky will remain partly overcast on Friday because of residual moisture after the rain. By Saturday, the sun will emerge in the sky, bringing the chill back.

The sun will emerge bright bring in the chill by Saturday when the mercury can slide down to 12°C.

“From Saturday afterwards we can expect sunny days. The mercury will start dipping again, so it will get colder by the weekend,” added Das.

Title: NMC to outsource operations of new Bytco hosp
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Nashik: The Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) is planning to outsource the operations of new Bytco hospital building to a private organisation or medical trust owing to manpower issues.

After getting poor response to the expression of interest (EoI) — floated around three months ago to appoint an organisation for running the super-speciality services at the hospital at minimum cost for city residents as per NMC’s terms and conditions — the civic body is planning to float the EoI for the second time.

The newly-constructed building of Bytco hospital, constructed at a cost of over Rs 40 crore, is lying idle for over five months as the NMC is yet to provide manpower, including doctors and nurses, for making the building operational.

The five-decade-old Bytco hospital, managed by the civic body, is one of the busiest hospitals in the city. The NMC had decided to build an additional building due constant increase of footfall at the hospital.

The new 200-bed building has a modular operation theatre. “The functioning of the new building is yet to start as the NMC is facing severe manpower issues at the existing Bytco hospital. We had sent a proposal to the state government for allowing us to appoint additional manpower for various departments, including health. But the state government is yet to give its nod,” a civic official said.

Recently during a meeting with the head of departments, municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game had directed the health department to explore possibilities whether the staff can be hired on contract basis to make the new hospital building operational.

“We will require specialists from cardiologists to oncologists to run the new super-specialist hospital. There have been many approved posts lying vacant in NMC’s existing hospitals, but recruitment is on hold due to lack of government permission,” an NMC official said.

“Around five months back, we had sent a proposal to the state government to recruit at least 150 vacant posts in the medical departments of NMC, but we are yet to get the nod,” he added.

The official said that the civic body is now planning to rope in an organisation that will run this new Bytco hospital and provide super-speciality services to residents at minimum cost. “We will soon invite the EoI from various organisations ready to operate this new hospital as per our terms and conditions,” the NMC official said.

“Although the new hospital is yet to become operational, we are planning to provide MRI and CT scan facilities at the ground floor of the new hospital building for the benefit of the patients. We have already started the work for installations of the machines. These facilities will be operational in the next four-five months,” he added.

Title: Public hearing on February 5 over power tariff hike proposal
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: Consumers can participate in a public hearing scheduled on February 5 on the electricity department's tariff proposal for the year 2020-2021.

Consumers have been requested to send in their suggestions and objections to the Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission (JERC) which will conduct the hearing as well as the Goa electricity department by February 3.

The power tariff is likely to rise in April, with the electricity department proposing a hike of 3.84%.

In its proposed tariff structure, the department is looking at cumulatively billing low tension consumers at a uniform rate for the entire consumption instead of the present staggered slab rate billing.

The new tariff structure has been proposed for low tension domestic, commercial and industries categories of consumers.

All low tension domestic consumers “whose consumption is more than 200 units shall lose the benefit of the first two slabs i.e. 0-100 and 101-200 units for the energy charges. Further, total monthly consumption of more than 200 units shall fall in the respective slab and accordingly applicable energy charges for that respective slab will be levied,” the department has stated.

There was no power tariff hike proposed by the department for the financial year 2019-2020 where the department informed JERC that it would meet the revenue gap of Rs 308 crore through state government’s budgetary support.

Consumers have been asked to send in objections and suggestions through post or email to the secretary JERC at secretaryjerc@gmail.com with a copy to the electricity department aeipm@yahoo.com by February 3.

Title: Union minister Prakash Javadekar condemns JNU violence
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Prakash Javadekar

NEW DELHI: Union minister Prakash Javadekar on Wednesday condemned the violence in JNU including the one resorted to by “some students’ union” when the administration started the registration of students for the current semester, saying that people would change their views once all facts about what actually happened came to light.

“First, we condemn any violence in any part of the country. We have a mature democracy and everyone has the right have his/ her views and hence there is no place for violence in this country, particularly in universities where all go for higher studies. These cannot be places for any violence,” he said.

The I&B minister, however, also highlighted what he called the violence allegedly used by “some students’ union” to stop the registration process

“Reports published by you (media) showed how some people locked the server room and nobody was allowed to use it. This should not be forgotten. This is not the meaning of education. This is against the education. Stopping students from registering themselves in education process is an anti-education attempt,” the minister said

“I have full faith that all masked man will be unmasked during police investigation. Police is investigating the entire episode,” Javadekar said. On why police have registered cases against protesting students, who have also been injured, Javadekar said, “Please obtain the right information from police why the FIR has been filed. If there is an FIR for locking the server room and stopping others from registration and educational activities, you will also change your views.”

Title: A-I seats bill to be placed in assembly
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Kolkata: The bill on de-reservation of Anglo-Indian seats in Parliament and state assemblies, which was passed in Parliament on December 12, will be placed in the state legislative assembly for its ratification on Thursday. The state is likely to veto it and send it back to Parliament. As per rules, the bill has to be passed by at least half the number of states of the country.

Chief minister Mamata Banerjee, who has been vehemently protesting against CAA and NRC , and who has been known to be supporting the Anglo-Indian community in its demand for continuing with the reservation in legislature, is likely to be present in the House on Thursday. A large representation of TMC MLAs is also likely.

In the assembly, Anglo-Indian MLA Shane Calvert will speak on why the reservation is necessary. “I have prepared my appeal and I hope to convince the House that the Anglo-Indians need this reservation for socio-economic protection. The entire fabric of de-reservation is based on false notions,” Calvert told TOI.

He added that this is the only community that finds mention in the Constitution and the framers thought that the minority community needed this reservation just as the SC/STs do, for the protection of their rights.

Incidentally, members of the community from across the country had converged in the city on Monday to discuss how to start a concerted movement against the de-reservation, that comes into effect on January 25.

Title: Bodgeshwar zatra vendors receive 65,000 paper bags
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Saligao: The Mapusa Municipal Council (MMC) has decided to provide paper bags to shopkeepers as well as fruit/sweet vendors at the Bodgeshwar zatra in Mapusa. The zatra, currently underway, draws thousands of devotees who pay their obeisance to the lord Bodgeshwar.

The MMC, which sought the assistance of the Rotary Club of Mapusa, handed over around 65,000 paper bags to the temple committee. The move follows a loan by the Goa State Urban Development Agency (GSUDA) to ensure that paper bags are provided. Thus, the civic body has formed teams headed by municipal inspectors empowered to challan anyone using single-use plastic . The MMC has also placed 30 bins around the temple.

MMC chairperson Ryan Braganza on Wednesday said that the municipality, along with GSUDA, implemented the drive to ban single-use plastic. “This is the third year the municipality, in co-ordination with the temple committee and GSUDA, has tried to put the drive into practice,” he said.

“The municipality has distributed around 1,200 plastic containers to put offerings in, thus the use of plastic bags will be reduced drastically,” said Braganza

MMC chief officer Clen Madeira said that the municipality has installed around eight portable bio-toilets and incurred an expenditure of Rs 1.6 lakh.

“I request the people to maintain the sanctity of the place, not dispose waste in the open, use bins which are placed at strategic locations, and shun the use of plastic,” said Madeira.

Title: Mangaluru: Pejawar seer’s demise stokes demand to rename Jokatte railway station
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Jokatte Railway station

MANGALURU: The passing away of the seer of Pejawar Adhokshaja Mutt Vishwesha Teertha has stoked a demand among train activists to rename Jokatte railway station as Pejawar. While train activists are pushing for this demand based on popular sentiment, authorities of Palakkad division of Southern Railway (SR), under whose jurisdiction Jokatte station is located, feel there is no need to rename the station and it should remain as it is.

Jokatte station is located between Mangaluru Junction and Thokur railway stations on the Mangaluru-Mumbai railway corridor under SR in Pejawar village, Malavoor gram panchayat. Renaming of the station was also the wish of Sri Vishwesha Teertha, who in February 2017 said the station should be named as Pejawar station, since it was located within the limits of Pejawar village. The station was then under construction, and got completed later.

This is not a new demand but an old one that train activists have been making ever since Palakkad division started construction of the railway station in 2016, said train activist Gopalakrishna Bhat. Dakshina Kannada MP Nalin Kumar Kateel, then Mulki-Moodbidri MLA K Abhayachandra Jain, Malavoor gram panchayat and other stakeholders too had endorsed the demand of the late seer. Despite this, SR named the station as Jokatte, he said.

Renaming the station as Pejawar Railway Station would have been an ideal tribute to the departed octogenarian seer, revered as a saint by not just his followers, but society as well, Bhat said. Malavoor GP in October 2017 had adopted a resolution that panchayat residents, gram sabhas and its members have been demanding that the new station coming up between Kenjar and Pejawar be named as Pejawar, Bhat said to further buttress his case.

Then leader of the opposition in state legislative council and minister Kota Srinivas Poojari in January 2019, in a letter to railway minister Piyush Goyal, had drawn the latter’s attention to this popular demand. The coastal district has the unique distinction of having a ‘moola mutt’ of one of the Ashta Mutts of Udupi Sri Krishna Temple at Pejawar, and the railway station there should be named as Pejawar station, Poojari had urged Goyal.

Pratap Singh Shami, divisional railway manager, Palakkad division, said Jokatte was the ideal name for the railway station, and that there was no need to change it. Asserting he was not aware of any demand to initially name or rename the station as Pejawar station since he assumed office, he said the station’s name will remain Jokatte. Incidentally, a vinyl name board at Jokatte stahad been torn up in March 2018.

Title: Sena, BJP men scuffle mars Ytl PS chief’s polls
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Yavatmal: Chairman and vice-chairman of all 16 panchayat samitis in the district were elected on Wednesday. Barring Yavatmal and Umarkhed, the election was peaceful.

In Yavatmal, there was a heated exchange of words between two warring groups belonging to Shiv Sena and BJP followed by a scuffle between the workers. The police had a tough time in pacifying the angry crowd gathered at the PS office.

In Umarkhed also, tension prevailed for some time as the rival groups indulged in unruly behaviour.

In Yavatmal PS, Kantabai Kamble of Shiv Sena and Ujjwala Gawande of Congress were elected as chairman and vice-chairman, respectively.

In Umarkhed, Pradnyanand Khadse of Congress and Vishakha Jadhav of NCP were elected as chairman and vice-chairman.

Shiv Sena bagged both the posts in Kalamb where Pooja Shelke and Vilas Rathod won the post of chairman and vice-chairman, respectively.

In Darwha, Shiv Sena candidates Sunita Raut and Namdev Jadhav were elected as chairman and vice-chairman, respectively.

BJP won both the posts as Prashant Tayade (chairman) and Sheela Salam (vice-chairman) were elected in Ralegaon PS.

In Pusad, NCP candidates Chaya Hagwane and Bhagwan Bhakre won the posts.

In Mahagaon PS, Anita Chavan of NCP and Ramchandra Tambake of Shiv Sena were elected as chairman and vice-chairman.

Neeta Jadhav of BJP and Subhaschandra Deshmukh of Shiv Sena were elected as chairman and vice-chairman in Ghatanji Panchayat Samiti .

Details of other PS are yet to be known officially.

Title: Mid-day meal agencies get surprise visitors from NMC
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Done

Nashik: A surprise inspection of mid-day meals being provided to the students of civic schools by 13 private agencies under the central kitchen scheme was conducted by the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) officials on Tuesday.

A total of 13 teams — comprising civic and FDA officials along with dieticians — were formed by the NMC to inspect the quality of foods being provided by these agencies.

The teams also visited the kitchens of these agencies where the meal is prepared. Now, a report will soon be prepared and submitted by the teams to municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game.

The General Body (GB) of the NMC had recently ordered the civic administration to cancel the contracts of all 13 agencies following complaints regarding sub-standard food and violation of conditions.

Mayor Satish Kulkarni had ordered the civic administration to cancel the contracts and allot the work of providing mid-day meal to women self-help groups. The directive came after leader of opposition from Shiv Sena Ajay Boraste had raised the issue during the GB meeting.

Principals of 13 municipal schools had also lodged complaints with the NMC’s education department about the quality of food being provided by these contractors and how they are violating the terms and conditions for providing mid-day meal to municipal school students.

As per the set terms and conditions, it was mandatory to bring mid-day meal for students in air-proof containers and closed vans. But the meal was being brought in open containers.

Corporators cutting across the party lines reiterated the same complaint and demanded cancellation of contracts of the existing 13 contractors. However, the civic administration is yet to cancel the contracts.

A civic official said that the teams were formed to check the quality of food being served to the students. “Reports will soon be submitted to the municipal commissioner in next few days and based on the report action will be taken against the contractors,” he said.

Title: Two Hyderabad ballkids to be part of Australian Open
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Vadakattu Sanskruti and BMV Aditya

HYDERABAD: The New Year couldn’t have begun on a better note for Vadakattu Sanskruti and BMV Aditya. The duo from Hyderabad will be part of the 10-member Indian contingent of ballkids for the Australian Open , the year’s first tennis Grand Slam tournament, beginning in Melbourne on January 20.

The rest of the ballkids comprise players from Mumbai, Kolkata, Ahmedabad, Gurugram, Chandigarh, Panchkula and Delhi. After the successful first edition of Ball Kids programme in 2019, this year’s selection programme was held in 10 cities in the lead-up to the tournament. The final squad was selected by Australian Open officials after putting the kids through a series of gruelling tests such as ball rolling technique, service skills, short sprints, written test, communication skills and overall personality.

In a selection that witnessed intense competition, 250 players were shortlisted from 1,500 applicants and called to Delhi for trials. The list was further pruned to 100 and from that 10 were selected also for their agility and quick hand-eye coordination.

14-year-old, Sanskruti who is standard 9 student of Gitanjali Devshala, Balamrai was also overjoyed at the prospect of seeing and meeting her idols, Rafael Nadal and Germany’s Angelique Kerber. “It gives me an opportunity to watch my idols live on court, which would be a treat,” she added.

Sanskruti was grateful to her school and coach for helping her realise this dream. “I thank my school management without which my tennis career would not have been possible. training and selection of Ballkids programme was very tough. We were trained by Shiva Kumar Reddy. He trained 25 of us in Hyderabad. Varshit, who was selected from Hyderabad last year, also guided us by sharing his experience,” Sanskruti said.

For Aditya too, it’ll be a heady experience, celebrating his 15th birthday (Jan 27) at the Open. A standard IX student of Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan, Jubilee Hills, Aditya is a bronze medallist at the Khelo India National games. “I’m very excited to represent India and it will be a dream come true for me to watch my favourite stars in action,” said the right-hander who, like Sanskruti, idolises world No. 1 Nadal of Spain.

Manohar Bhat, vice-president, Kia Motors India, wished all the ballkids well. “It is great to see so many enthusiasts believing in their passion for the sport,” he said.

Title: In a first, HC grants bail to approver in MCOCA case
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Mumbai: In a significant order, the Bombay high court on Wednesday granted bail to an approver in an organised crime case over an alleged Rs 10 crore extortion demand made by gangster Suresh Pujari from Malaysia. This is the first such order by Bombay HC of bail granted to an approver in a MCOCA case.

Sharad Agarwal (36) had approached HC after a special court designated under the Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA) had rejected his bail in October 2019. His counsel Raja Thakare with advocates Pratap Nimbalkar and Siddharth Jagushte contended before Justice S K Shinde that though he was arraigned as an accused in the case, he was since granted pardon as an approver in September 2019 and thus entitled to bail.

Agarwal said he was falsely accused in the case and that he is a businessman with a travel firm, languishing in Thane central jail since 2015 after his arrest by Mumbai police as part of its investigation into the Pujari syndicate.

There is a statutory bar under the Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) on the release of an approver till completion of the trial, argued prosecutor Sharmistha Kaushik.

But Thakare argued since Agarwal was granted a pardon and since he now has “a status of a witness” and “has not breached any condition (if any) imposed on him while granting pardon”, the trial court erred in not applying its mind judiciously to his case.

Police received the sanction to prosecute under MCOCA in January 2016. A chargesheet was filed before the special MCOCA court in Mumbai against Agarwal and others.

The prosecution’s case is the complainant claimed to have received a call in September 2015 from an international number and the caller said he was Suresh Pujari from Malaysia and demanded Rs 10 crore.

The prosecution had before the special trial court recorded its “no objection” to release the applicant on bail, subject to the condition that he remain present before it on every hearing and not tamper with evidence.

Till date, only eight witnesses have been examined out of 41 and the approver has been in jail for over a year after being granted pardon under Section 307 of the CrPC, noted HC.

Title: Patna: 17-year-old raped, accused arrested
Content:
This story is from January 9, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: One Sonu Thathera (19) was arrested on early Wednesday morning from Fatuha police station area in Patna district for allegedly raping a 17-year-old girl after dragging her to a secluded place near Fatuha railway station on Tuesday night.

Fatuha SDPO Maneesh said the victim had left her residence in Sheikhpura district as her parents were pressurising her to marry a man much older than her age. He said the victim boarded a train to Patna in the hope of getting some job. Her 14-year-old maternal cousin was also accompanying her.

“Sonu, who belonged to Nalanda but lived at Fatuha with his family, had boarded the same train at Barh and after listening to their conversation, offered his help to get her a job and shelter at night. However, Sonu started dragging her to a secluded place filled with vegetation after they came out of Fatuha station,” he said. The accused is married.

The SDPO said the victim’s cousin apprehended trouble and ran back to the station and alerted the railway protection force (RPF) personnel there. But by the time police could trace her, the girl was raped.

“An FIR was lodged on the victim’s statement. She had a cellphone number which was provided by Sonu while travelling with her. Police traced the accused on that basis and arrested him within six hours of the incident,” he said.

The SDPO said Sonu had broken his sim card but the cellphone he used to call the victim while travelling was seized along with the clothes he was wearing at the time of crime.
